1lyPVVTLOS-PZ8yqt3wuBw.text: What I like (love) about this place: the different flavored aioli served every time with the homemade potato chips (I save the aioli for my delicious omelette or eggs), the best bacon (pork slab), their avocado is always perfect, the little treats they bring you at the end, AND the very friendly servers. I'm pretty sure almost everyone is related and they are all nice. I also love the fact that I don't have to drive to the strip and pay for parking. These people know what they are doing. I almost didn't want to write this review because others would find out about it. But, I also want them to stay in business.

Photo of Zenaida's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. An example of the yummy treat at the end. Not sure how often they do this, but we&#39;ve had a nice little surprise almost every time!

nnFOk60ataheD7Dt_O_YGg.text: Gotta love it when the chef personally meets and greets his dining guests after he cooks the meal! Not that I needed any changes made to my order, but I'm sure he'd be willing to accommodate to any modifications. His eggs benedict was one of the best I've ever had for breakfast, and I think I'll be skipping lunch and possibly dinner too because of how filling the meal was. The eggs were perfectly poached the way I liked (meaning that when I popped the center with my fork, the yolk gushed out in all its glorious-gooey creaminess), and even though I prefer thin bacon, the thicker and meatier bacon that came with the eggs was very flavorful.  The side of breakfast potatoes were just as tasty, lightly salted, and slightly crisp.  I wish I didn't have to wait a several more hours for my stomach to digest before I can dig into the homemade cinnamon roll that I also ordered to-go... Look for Zenaida's Cafe right next to the State Farm insurance office.  The outside of the cafe doesn't really stand out among the other businesses in the shopping plaza where it's located, but the food inside sure does!  Support the small chef-owned eateries and give Zenaida's cafe a try!  Sooo, a few weeks later... I went back to grab just a small lunch of chicken wings and a side of fries, but my 'quickie' lunch turned into a mini feast of 2 generous portions of freshly cooked fries (I didn't know plain fries came with my order of wings, but the garlic rosemary fries were too tempting to pass up), 7 pieces of succulent, Southern style wings with hot sauce and homemade bbq sauce on the side, and an unexpected complimentary cookies n cream (thank-you-Chef-for-ruining-my-diet) dessert which I gladly made extra room for in my already full stomach!  Next time, I'll be ordering the cookies n cream to go because otherwise, I won't have the stomach space to sample everything else on the menu!

4cGFHRZxIq9IOe_yNVrf9w.text: Delicious food , beautifully plated, and prices are reasonable considering the excellent quality of the ingredients . The smoked salmon was on point and the blend of capers , onions , tomato and cheese was sooooo good! My friend had the pancakes and she was enjoying them; when we were presented with a pudding that was sinfully rich , topped with a delicate mix of sweet and spice ; it was like tasting a holiday . Compliments of the chef ! We couldn't believe it ! We were honored and happy to have such a wonderful experience at this hidden gem away from the loud busy crowded tourist spots. Service was efficient , attentive , and personalized . Quiet place , feels like home , music ranges from upbeat to chill and relaxed. Bohemian decor invites you to have some coffee , read your favorite book and maybe strike up a conversation with a kindred spirit . Outdoor sitting is dog friendly, which was also a nice surprise, next time I will bring my poodle with me so she can enjoy the treats served at Zenaida's .

HoqlasiVFv67EcHUwDqPdg.text: When we walked in, we was automatically greet by the staff. They are very nice and welcoming. The inferior was simple and they even had a jukebox. I don't know if it was working. The food is delicious and fresh.   For starters we ordered avocado toast to shared. This is my first time having legit avocado toast and I am happy I had it here. It comes in 5 pieces and there is a small salad on top of the toast. The avocado toast was delicious! The toast, avocado, tomatoes and onion all perfectly blended together to make this one dish.  My sister order the waffle and turkey sausage. The waffle had whip creme and strawberries. It was a yummy and fluffy waffle. The whip cream and strawberries made it even better, I did not even need to use syrup. The turkey sausage cake in 4 pieces. They were a good size and was pretty thick.   I ordered the chicken breast sandwich. The sandwich was big and it came with fries. It was a pesto chicken sandwich with tomatoes. The chicken pieces were huge which I liked. I was only able to finish half of it.   They also gave us a complimentary dessert! It was 2 fresh baked cookies. It was soft and it put a smile on my face after the first bite. I love cookies and especially since it was fresh it made me even happier. I would pay for this cookie, so I can take it home to eat. It was a surprising and perfect dessert to end the meal. We will definitely be back.

T7DlCYStFD09YrBZnGiKPw.text: Great place to have Brunch. We had a Salmon Benedict, where the Salmon was freshly fished by the Chef in Alaska. We also had the best avocado toasts. Highly recommended!

_RFItLFJSw80EpOOX-lk3g.text: My wife and I did not think this restaurant lived up to all its praise on Yelp. However, we'll chalk it up to them just having a bad day. A 4 is very generous given our experience.  The staff was very, very nice and pleasant.

-UXerSEJQS5Fzg04CfyOYw.text: No nonsense food, it was great to come in and enjoy a meal that wasn't over complicated yet so full of flavor.   I ordered the "Eggs Benedict" which came with a side of their breakfast potatoes. The presentation was simple, English muffin topped with two thick cut pieces of bacon side by side, poached egg and then the hollandaise sauce nicely covering the whole thing. Such a great flavor on the hollandaise sauce and the bacon with egg created such a delicious melody that balanced each other very well.   My friends enjoyed different meals like the BLTA Sandwich, I was able to take a bite and it was such a fresh crisp feel, savory notes from the avocado and the sauce. The baguette was soft and did not jab your mouth like most do.   The other meal was a smoked salmon plate which was devoured completely, it was a nice plate bagel, salmon and all the other toppings neatly arranged along side for you to create your own delicious bite.   The service was excellent and the chef came out to check on us and apologize for the wait....which there was none! It was a pleasant pause for you to enjoy your conversation and get ready for the meal you are destined to enjoy. We were fortunate enough to enjoy some delicious sweet and soft cookies after our meal which perfectly ended the experience.   I would invite any of you on the fence to give this place a try, it is definitely a great place and I hope it continues to succeed and stick around for a long time so I can continue to try new things on their menu.  Thank you to the chef for an amazing breakfast with friends.

K9w7dxpM80OPmeiPubzMxw.text: We loved our brunch at Zenaida's! This cafe has excellent food, with a real deal chef -hat and all- visible from an open window into the kitchen.   We enjoyed a monstrous cinnamon roll, prepared with whipped cream, fresh berries, and caramel - YUM. Next was a monte cristo breakfast sandwich that had a spicy mayo and delicious chorizo. Our other entree was the tofu scramble, which was INCREDIBLE. Perfectly oily, seasoned, and an excellent blend of veggies, tofu, and rice. The chef sent out complimentary fire roasted pumpkin bread pudding to finish our meal, which was a perfect, thoughtful gesture - and very yummy! All the food was presented exceptionally well.   Service was excellent, with two servers helping us out, each with friendly recommendations and attentiveness.   The restaurant itself was very clean, colorful, and cute, with booths and tables, as well as a comfy couch/coffee table area and a couple of outside tables as well.   Thanks for a lovely experience!

U6mcdiAjcjwYxzrWzGrD1Q.text: So after an amazing hair appointment I decided to call up a friend for a spur of the moment lunch date. I tell him, "meet me for tacos at such n such". As I pulled into my parking spot I found myself staring at a sign that reads, "Just good food"! I thought to myself, "Self....let's see just how good it is!" So with a quick text we had a change of plans. As soon as I walked in I knew it was going to be good....I was greeted by a beautiful smile, seated right away and don't even get me started with the smells coming from the kitchen. The decor is adorable. The staff is super friendly, quick and efficient! The food? OMG! The food is amazing! I think my favorite part of the meal(besides my lunch date of course) was a quick hello from the Chef! So if you're looking for a quaint, delicious breakfast, brunch or lunch spot I highly recommend that you pop into Zenaida's Cafe, enjoy the fresh potato chips with garlic aioli and stay for the chocolate chip cookies at the end. I will definitely be back because I think I'm going to have to try everything on the menu at least once!

iVUJ02WDjz_IgrUBV0Qvww.text: Today was my second time there and it didn't disappoint. I think I need to go a zillion more times so I can try everything and the specials. Today I had the chicken and waffle. Generous serving and so good you eat the whole thing because you don't want to stop eating. The chicken has an amazing flavor and cooked perfectly. The waffle was nice and fluffy and soaked up the syrup beautifully. My friend got the eggs Benedict and she was super happy. We also got a n order of fried zucchini to share and we gobbled them right up. You can tell everything is cooked from scratch with fresh ingredients. Even though I am in a food coma, can't wait for my next visit. Also, the chef sent out some homemade chips with a garlic aioli good enough to bathe in and at the end of the meal warm chocolate chip cookies! You can tell everything is cooked with love and you can feel it while there. Food nirvana!

lssLJnsHKL2dKQVudBL7gA.text: Wow wow wow!!! Definitely more than a 5 star restaurant. As soon as you walk in you are welcomed with a smile and feel the positive vibe in here. Food was more than great! You can definitely taste that it's made from scratch and not canned. What amazed me the most is that the Cheff himself came out to greet us, ask us how the food was and made conversation with us. Our waiter was also friendly and gave us the best undivided attention ever. We never had to ask for a water refill, he automatically provided service. Were from San Bernardino and Orange County, wish they were here! Thank you for a great meal and outstanding service!

FvG4RwesdV0tW7dymo0f1A.text: First time trying this place and I came to try the bacon and the chef's complimentary chocolate chip cookie!   4 stars for delicious thick bacon! I also like how their waffle dish comes with meat (sausage or bacon) included!  $9.69 (tax included) is a pretty sweet deal. Seems that the whipped cream is homemade. My only complaint is my waffle didn't come out crispy, even after checking with the waiter to make sure it's crispy and he put it as a request on my tab.   It was nice that the Chef stopped by my table and other tables to apologize for the delay and see if everything was alright. But, by then I ate my entire waffle.  Star for attentive service. Thumbs up. ;)   I'd recommend this place though and I'll give it another try, especially if the Chef keeps on giving his complimentary cookie! ;)

pAy85GGWCfMHBUYPZmaq9g.text: Checked in for Sunday brunch.  Atmosphere: Cosy, charming and unassuming!  Service: The wait staff were thoroughly convivial, akin to visiting a beloved relative in the South. Chef Sterling was incredibly humble as he took the time to stop by diners' tables, and later guided us through the gallery of his career achievements.  Food: Spectacular on every front! We ordered "Fried Chicken & Waffle", "Zenaida's Breakfast" and an omelette loaded with greens (a spinach omelette, if memory serves right?). The cuisine exuded character, and outstanding flavour (plus hearty portions). To top it off, the complimentary offerings, home-made potato chips with aioli ("amuse-bouche"), and  ambrosia salad ("petits fours"), were utterly delightful!  Verdict: Definitely tops our list of favourite brunch spots in the Southwest!

ZutksMWO2DK2Qqf8pGrzIQ.text: This was a great brunch place for escaping the Vegas scene. It was a very cheery, comfortable, casual atmosphere. I came here with my family, and the speed in which they brought out the food, all 6 dishes, was very impressive! Plus, the waiter refilled my drink without me even noticing..that showed how skilled he was at his job. The food was fantastic, but what really made the meal 5 stars was the experience. The chef came around and genuinely thanked every table for coming, forming a valuable connection with each guest. Everyone was also offered fresh-baked cookies drizzled in caramel as a complimentary dessert to finish off a pleasant meal. They were so warm and comforting and honestly melted in our mouths. Small gestures like this make all the difference.

photos.caption: Photo of Zenaida's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Their hollandaise sauce is soo delicious. I ordered the pork stack (pictured in the bottom middle) and was very happy with my order.

PaMLgZH_1V80JuUUuMDRfg.text: Owner Chef is there all the time the food is very good. Owner was very nice he came to the table. Worth a try also the owner says they have jazz nights on certain Fridays Sinatra themed. Four course dinner

5EVZNi5KgxZ4WtepdC-kHg.text: Zero question in my mind as to why this place has 5 stars on 196 reviews. I went in this morning with 2 coworkers around 930. There were no other patrons in the restaurant at the time which could be alarming.   I went with the chicken and waffles on the favorites portion of the menu. The waffle was dense yet not dry. The chicken was very well seasoned and tasty. My only complaint is that I wish they gave a little more chicken for the price.   My buddies got bacon and eggs breakfast plates. The bacon was possibly the thickest bacon I've ever seen. I didn't get to taste it but they both noted that it was delicious.   The server was very nice and attentive. When we were finished, the chef sent out a small treat on the house- pumpkin bread pudding. It was absolutely delicious.   I'd go back here any day and it's close to my office so I know I'll be back again.   Give it a go!

bN4xeDBk_gu47bo-UrjNkQ.text: Great service. Great food and on top of that amazing people. If you looking for a breakfast spot in Vegas pull up here! Also was blessed with amazing cookies by the chef!

HOPLYPT60Whial8fylqLaA.text: A friend brought me here the other morning, after a brisk morning hike. The food hit the spot. I was especially impressed that the chef is proud of the food he creates. I don't recall the last time I had a chef come out from the kitchen to ask if the food is to my liking. Everyone was warm, welcoming and accommodating. The food was cooked perfect & full of flavor. The customer service, alone, would be enough to ensure repeat visits. Thank you all for the great experience.

J4_fdPEAckeY21Wu37Sk9Q.text: This place is such a gem. The restaurant is small and quaint while also feeling clean and open. The servers are all fantastic and the chef is amazing as well. Because I was a server at one point, I can really tell when a chef pours his heart and soul into their restaurant. This is one of those places. The food was so fresh and light without feeling like I was missing out on something.  I ordered the avocado toast, an egg and their breakfast potatoes. Everything was cooked very well and the flavors were on point. If you're looking for your next laid back breakfast spot, I highly recommend coming here. You will not be disappointed!

q3g1Y68ajV62EtZ5L4FPyA.text: Great and clean place! But only one server which made service slow! Will def go back because the good is so outstanding!

photos.caption: Photo of Zenaida's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best egg Benedict in town

cBb9otqcA9lYNyzXFZ8Kow.text: No wonder this place has 5 stars. Pin pointing what everyone else said: hidden gem and grandma's house.  You would never really know this place was here unless you stumbled upon this parking lot. We, however, found this lovely place on Yelp. Thank you, yelp. It truly is a remarkable place! Home-good feeling, wonderful aromas, a home-town setting.   Christmas music, happy employees, regular customers. A place you just want to be!  We started off with the cinnamon roll and boy was it out of this world! Sweet cream icing, whipped cream, some sort of drizzle, and berries on top with cinnamon. The smell is something memorable. SO delicious! I've never thought to eat a cinnamon roll with fruits but boy was it yummy! It was pretty big, yet we still ate it all. Our main courses arrived. Jaw dropping! The presentation was perfect and the food even better. Monte Cristo all the wayyy. The sandwiches cut perfectly in the middle. Eggs also very well cooked. Potatoes were how potatoes should be - crispy on the outside, soft on the inside. And everything was just so amazing.  Dessert of two warm chocolate chip cookies with whipped cream was thoughtfully made by chef, who also came by and made sure everything was going well. And it was just an all around amazing experience. Babe and I are excited to come back to try some other things on the menu.  Thank you for gracing us with your wonderful cooking, Chef!

6hRtVbBmr5XXadMtknMJfQ.text: Amazing place!  Everything was delicious..  the visit from the chef to our table made us feel so welcome. Definitely coming back to this place on my next visit to Vegas.

RLvJPQxJzjcFAwOdWC1XBw.text: Best cafe I've ever been to! I'll definitely be coming back here whenever I'm in Vegas. Excellent food & service. The chef even comes out to greet his customers. Make sure to try the avocado toast, so many flavors & the bread melts in your mouth. I try to replicate it for a tasty, healthy breakfast but it doesn't even compare.

P2ISxGsCgpcKJkF4YN7ANw.text: Wow! This is definitely a hidden gem! The food here is delicious!   Ambiance: Super casual! It feels like walking into grandmas house for breakfast. The decor is all types of mixed and super comfy/inviting.   Service: It was good. We spoke to 3 different people during our visit. First was the young lady who came to take our drink orders. She wasn't very friendly and seemed annoyed/ in a hurry. My mom asked a question about the menu and she was pretty short with her. Looked like she was in a big hurry but there were only 4 other parties at the restaurant with us. Our server was a nice guy! He was professional and took care of us, also had a little sense of humor which brightened up the mood! Last, the chef personally came out and asked how our food was which was a huge plus, he was so sweet and you can tell he genuinely cares about what he does and puts a lot of love into it.  Food: Everything was delicious! We started off with the avocado toast, the toast was crunchy on the outside soft and fluffy on the inside, the flavor, presentation and composition were incredibly amazing making this one of my favorite dishes! For my entree I ordered the Eggs Benedict with potatoes and everything was amazing! The tick cut bacon was my favorite part but it's definitely a classic dish I recommend. My mom ordered the tofu scramble and she loved it, it was a good size to share! For dessert we ordered the cinnamon roll and wow! It was soft, warm, and creamy with fresh fruit and a delicious icing on top. Last we're the freshly baked cookies. The ooey gooey delicious baked and delivered from heaven chocolate chip cookies. Y'all I'm not kidding these were the best, with a caramel drizzle and whipped cream. I'm telling you, you'll love it!   Extras: I heard they have a special menu Friday nights! You need to get on their email list but this is so awesome! Bathroom was also nice and clean with cute decorations.

_BucM6ZAgkHF6Q3fHXHLvA.text: I had an outstanding lunch experience here.  The server and cook were very friendly and enthusiastic.  I had the vegan quinoa burger which contained delicious vegan cheese and avocado and was scrumptious and filling.  The flat bread that enclosed the sandwich was soft and tasty. 83R-akcJlV8yKMX7V_7KMA.text: Simply amazing ! Their food is always made perfectly, portions are fantastic. The cinnamon rolls and fresh complimentary cookies are the absolute best. The chef even comes out to check on guests. He made me another set of eggs for my eggs Benedict simply because he didn't like the way the first set came out. AMAZING!

lP3fKkPXKX51xf4fK0uE9Q.text: Such a hidden gem! Came here after seeing all the great reviews on yelp and did not disappoint. Very reasonably price's for great food. Presentation was awesome and service was great. Chef even came out a couple times to make sure we were enjoying our meal. Even got a couple of fresh baked chocolate chip cookies as a surprise at the end of our meal! Will be coming back and recommending to friends and family. Keep up the great work! Log80EKz1DRxr11AThv9RQ.text: Really impressed by the fresh quality and beautiful presentation of the food, not to mention the large portions and reasonable prices. Ordered Eggs Benedict, Rib Hash daily special, and half an order of biscuits and gravy. You can taste the fresh ingredients. They really pay attention to how the food is made.  Restaurant located in a regular strip mall; interior is casual and inviting. Restaurant opened 7 months ago. Staff is super friendly.   Chef Sterling came out to greet all the customers and I told him how much we were enjoying our meal. At the end of the meal we were so stuffed but received as a gift from the chef a decadent dish of soft chocolate chip cookies topped with chantilly cream and strawberries. What a great way to end our meal!   Will definitely come back every time we are in vegas!

RCNCLTcNaQXbVFmErVyYUA.text: My wife and I dined here yesterday morning, 2/26, on the last day of a long weekend in Vegas.  We were looking for something off-strip, so we could avoid large crowds, ostentatious buffets and inflated pricing.  I selected Zenaida's on the strength of their Yelp rating, and we were absolutely not disappointed.  Right after we ordered, we were treated to a small plate of house-made chips and "enchilada aioli", compliments of the chef.  Not sure what was in the dip, but it was delicious!  We opted to start with the cinnamon bun, which was an absolute delight.  Warm, sweet and sticky, and piled high with a mound of whipped cream.  My wife enjoyed the Sterling breakfast: two eggs made to order, delicious breakfast potatoes and the thickest, juiciest slab of bacon I'd ever seen.  This was precisely the simple breakfast fare we were after, but done with such a high quality that it easily could have been featured in any of the high-end restaurants on The Strip.  I ordered the Eggs Benedict, which was also fantastic.  Eggs done perfectly (I prefer mine scrambled), the same thick-cut bacon, and a well-balanced Hollandaise sauce made for a delicious treat.  This, too, came with breakfast potatoes, which were crispy and MOLTEN LAVA HOT (seriously, be careful here).  After the meal, the chef sent out a plate of bunuelos-esque fried pita chips and whipped cream.  We practically needed to be rolled out of the restaurant.  Prices were extremely modest by Vegas standards, with the full meal for two running just over $30.  The staff at the cafe was friendly and genuinely eager to please.  Service before and during our meal was attentive, with ample refills to my coffee.  There was a slight slump in service when the time came to handle the check, but I am more than willing to let that slide in the face of the excellent experience we had otherwise.  We don't travel to Las Vegas frequently, but I am sure we'll be back here the next time we come around.  In the meantime, please do yourselves a favor and check this place out!

photos.caption: Photo of Zenaida's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cinnamon bun circa 2/26/17.

uSE7WN2rYKCyfTOZYZcK1g.text: Supporting Live music and Zenaida's!    Hoping to make these Jazz nights permanent, I'll throw my educated, experienced 2 cents in on the $40 gourmet dinner with renowned Jazz pianist!      However arriving there.. then scrutinizing the larger print, it shocked us that all but 2 (?) entrees were really quite $$ higher. The hostess was most cordial. As seemed an intimate venue, we hoped to socialize and make new friends. However we two senior sweeties were cloistered ringside to a celebrated jazz guest.  Doesn't he deserve at least a 4 or 6 top frontstage?  So like a couple on a prom date we romantically sat alone by stage. We reckoned part of the high price was the featured artist. Sadly, other than us starting the applause, his art was barely acknowledged.    Otherwise everyone was having a wonderful time!    I took my gaze from pianist and saw two tiny sensually sauced toasts   at my dinner partners elbow. "hmmm" I sniffed, "when is he bringing mine?"  "Uh, think this is for both of us!" Returning to my table later, I saw a lovely little 10 leaf Caesar salad. Well, isn't that nice they split our salad? "No" Deana said, "That IS your salad"  She then swallowed one fragrant morsel of something, "and that was MY lobster horderve "  Now, I like being thin and having a small stomach, however these starters were the sparsest starters I've ever ended up with.   Happy High school girlfriends siping our chilled byob champagne, giggling,  grooving to music and still starving to death until with chagrined hunger we plead for another tiny toast....        Then... Va Va Voom! Our entrees were forklifted in. A plentiful portion of gorgeous Chicken Marcella was plopped down in front of Deana. Two servers lifted my Fettuccine platter down to me.  The first sumptuous mouthfuls brought a swoon to my stomach, a smile on my smacker!  A sparky, spicy bacony topping kicked in, contrasting textures and creamy flavors swirling into some of the best fettucini I have ever had!    However...it was beyond rich, so killer, that after several voluptuous mouthfuls, my brow began to sweat, I felt faint. I was left comatose, staring at this magnificent throbbing mound of warm, melted, dripping cheese and hot oozing butter..  Way too much, way too late.  No big O!    Realizing they had a next seating we settled our bill. Gifted Chef Sterling graciously stopped by our table. Deana did her happy Marcella dance to the car while I hauled my 2 lbs of Fettuccine Carbonara behind me.   It was a perfect, imperfect evening.   We hope to attend again and bring friends next time!

VQir2O9oQsFwUbAPpjtNgQ.text: Hidden gem for sure! Cozy little spot with an eclectic "grandma's house" feel.  The menu is small, but has a lot of different variety. There are quite a few vegan options too. When I told the waiter I didn't eat pork or beef he suggested I substitute the ham on the eggs benedict for avocado and it was amazing!   They also brought us free chips with a delicious homemade dipping sauce. At the end of our meal the cook came out and thanked us for coming in, which was super nice. They also gave us two free fresh baked cookies for dessert. The food was delicious and the staff were amazing. Will definitely make this a go to spot when I'm on that side of town.

SxasWh149AUr0awQTpG5ig.text: This place is a hidden gem.  Staff is great and food is delicious.  Chef Sterling always come out to say hi and makes sure we are satisfied.  We have been there for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The same quality service each time.

vaiA3fysFo7ruM0T684LFg.text: Found this amazing little treasure near work and tried it out for lunch. It was like stepping into a combination diner/someone's living room. The service was excellent, it was quiet but food seemed to move swiftly through the kitchen. The chef even stepped out to make sure we were enjoying the meal. I ordered the garlic rosemary fries, which were delicious, and a very large serving. I also had the avocado toast, served with a side salad and topped with tomatoes and pickled onions that brightened it up. My friend ordered the corned beef hash and enjoyed it. After the meal we were served pumpkin spiced bread pudding as a gift from the chef. It was amazing!

IUGlkwOrdwPe7Q6XqdboqA.text: This family owned and operated cafe not only has a relaxing atmosphere but the food is delicious and made to order.  Everything is fresh and enjoyable. You need to try this place.

Ce3ZFf38a0iTchN4CfAm3A.text: Three of us had breakfast here this morning because of the rave reviews on Yelp and several other sites. It was a good choice. Eggs and sausages perfectly done. Diced potatoes seasoned and served hot. They were so good. One of our diners ordered the avocado toast for us to share and it really was  an unusual, and interesting dish. We loved it. No complaints here. The owner/chef Sterling, came over to our table and spoke with us. A very friendly man who seems to love his job. The tall toke said he knew what he was doing. Sterling's daughter Carmen, was hostess and server. Not only cute as a button but a sweet bubbly personality.. and very efficient. The furnishings and decor are no frills simple, but the place is very clean. We came for the food and we left satisfied and knowing we would be back again.

3ocDlYrKG2ggOhY4WGCsMA.text: My friends and I were looking for a quick place to eat on the way to the airport and came across this great place based on Yelp reviews. We added Zenaida to our contact list because we will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

pX2og-gbn8TRJGwjRpG_dg.text: Zenaida's was AMAZING!! Skip the strip in Las Vegas and make it a point to eat at this gem!! This is our new go to restaurant here. Food, service and atmosphere were all great! Cheers to the fantastic chef! You absolutely have to have their handmade potato chips... they're like nothing you have ever had! Q4R8BiuyIeqpKe-I0aV7xA.text: We had the corned beef hash, shrimp and grits and turkey stack. All of them were great. Portion sizes are generous.  The chef came out to ask how the food was which was noce of him.

Can't wait to go back! I wish they were open for dinner!

W_cENZEzm-vQNA-gcYl4Jg.text: The best breakfast in all of Las Vegas, and a legitimate contender for best in the country. Chef Sterling takes traditional breakfast and brunch foods and elevates them into something extraordinary. The service and ambiance and prices and comfort level are all excellent, but it's the food that makes this place unforgettable and that allows it to go toe-to-toe with the Michelin star restaurants on the Strip. The entire menu is spectacular, but my favorites are the biscuits and gravy and the corned beef hash.

eQcQRGB_3itihk1ZzSjZEA.text: OMG!!!! The best place to get a perfect breakfast! The food was really outstanding! It's a little hidden but please go there and enjoy this place. We all agreed that the cinnamon roll is what Greek gods called ambrosia.

uFVqnJ023H0GgIqnh1fX5Q.text: Average food at best, very slow service, forgot 1/3 items we ordered and had us waiting 5-10 minutes for them to set a table when we got there. What really bothered me tho was that basically every review mentioned that they give out free cookies at the end of the meal. We watched as they gave them to basically every other guest. None were given to us, we even waited around for like 5 minutes after the check to see if they would come but nope, nothing.

J2LDa9psGPWP7YOsijYpVA.text: Visiting vegas and looking for a change of pace for breakfast...this place was nice...eggs benedict were very good...asian scramble with tofu was good as well...above average coffee and friendly service...will definitely stop back when in town again...

The Z pancakes which are actually griddle cakes with bacon and two eggs over medium were delicious and customer service very friendly. My wife said her breakfast burrito was yummy and huge. ***Highly Recommend***We will be back.

cijWTpNF5VKR0AIg21IWow.text: Stopped in to grab a quick breakfast and was pleasantly surprised! The eggs benedict was very good. You also get complimentary chips and cookies. The service is phenomenal! The chef truly warms your heart and makes your day 100% better. 10/10 recommend!

vpOpzHfSkz19njJL3D08ag.text: First time coming here. The hostess and server were both very nice. I ordered the tofu scramble which was delicious and my boyfriend ordered eggs Benedict. J6L4xwZR8qeOAwrtPxMJYg.text: Excellent customer service. Very attentive. Food is delicious! I would recommend coming here for breakfast/lunch if you're in town. Shout out to the chef

9zA6ro-1NhJ2Rgb7SKYLaA.text: Read the reviews and decided to try this past Sunday for breakfast.   With all the great reviews, I expected it to be really busy and was dreading a long wait.   We arrived and it wasn't busy. Maybe 2 or 3 other tables with people.  Great for us!   Staff was super friendly and helpful.  My 5 yr old wanted the avocado toast.  Now everyone seems to do avocado toast, but whatever, fine.  We'll get it.   It arrived and I was ever so surprised.   Slices of grilled/lightly toasted baguette topped with smashed avocado, a grape or cherry tomato on top, pickled onion and a balsamic glaze drizzled.  It was one of the best avocado toasts I've had.   We got the monte Cristo.  My husband raves about it.  It was just too meaty for me.   Also, we got the corned beef hash.  Nothing to write home about.  Almost the texture of canned corned beef.  Not a fan. I like a chunky corned beef hash, but that's my own personal preference.   At the end of the meal, we received a plate of chocolate chip cookies, fresh from the oven.  One problem, they were drizzled with some type of unnecessary glaze.  Way too sweet for us.    Gave this 5 stars because: 1) nice and quiet, almost relaxing, unlike most of the other morning breakfast spots 2) the avocado toast! 3) The service was great 4) everything besides the hash was awesome  Will definitely be back!

95LFg2B-CXLNvnovVpPPZg.text: My first time to Las Vegas and wanted to try mom and pop cafe for Breakfast excellent service and excellent food.

2GwjH6S8kcNdLdrHcwP8uA.text: One of the best breakfast places I've been to in Vegas. I definitely recommend the biscuits and gravy  and breakfast burrito. Amazing staff and owner.

XDJNq0vF1dXE4wdJbt5J1g.text: This place was amazing. Before coming into the restaurant there's a cute fountain with two tables outside, perfect for nice weather. Once we walked in our host/server welcomed us in. She was very nice and welcoming. As we were being seated the chef said hello as well, which mind you doesn't really happen. They have their regular menu + a today's special menu. We ordered the tri tip on a baguette, nacho style fries, quinoa vegan burger, and cookies and cream for dessert. The tri tip sandwich and quinoa burger was amazing. Even the salad you can tell all the veggies and ingredients were carefully picked out. There were no bruises on any of the greens, I was so surprised! The chef came up to us and made sure we were enjoying the food.   Hands down a place you should check out and see for yourself how awesome this place is.

1ynGMtaCqiXP6IF6DLZBeA.text: Amazing pleasant staff. Hands down one of the best restaurants in Vegas with absolutely delicious food.

vrkNAESS658micZt-IQr1g.text: This place is amazing! The cinnamon roll, shrimp and grits, and corned beef was delicious. The shrimp and grits were my favorite. So so so good! The cream on the cinnamon roll is crazy good. My husband and I came on a Sunday morning with our 1 year old and there was no wait. As soon as you walk in they were so kind and friendly.  Before we left the chef gave us warm cookies and a little baggies of animal crackers for our son. It was so sweet. We will definitely be back. Our server was a guy with a fresh tattoo, I forget his name and he is awesome. So nice and made us feel so welcome.

DPXGoPsxves34rvfdncUEQ.text: This is a cute cafe with delicious down home cooking!  Sterling's homemade potato chips, gratis, are so tasty-even for breakfast!  The waffle was moist and fluffy, with homemade caramel sauce and tastiest & creamiest homemade whip cream. Cut from slab bacon was crisp and flavorful. At end of meal we were treated to hot from oven fresh baked choc chip cookies!  Definitely a treat, well off the strip in Vegas, but worth the time.

exK2lbiXu2KyAScq3lfAuQ.text: Yum yum yum!  We have been there twice within one week. Both dishes I ordered (cornbeef hash and cheesy shrimp grits) are delicious.  The portions are large.  My husband had the breakfast burrito, he commented that there must be 4-5 eggs in that.  We could've easily just split that and call it good.  So tasty it was, he ate the whole thing and was uncomfortably stuffed for hours after.   I definitely am looking forward to be back again to check out more dishes!

otIuaV7Ux92pcrSQqvFl6w.text: **9/1/18 updated review**  Sadly another high rated place of mine that's fallen from its ranks.  We came here for late breakfast on Saturday and it was pretty busy. Didn't realize busy would mean such a fail every step of the way.  We were seated fairly quickly but the waiter was obviously short/stressed. Service was not warm at all.  There were a few other tables where patrons looked obviously miffed with food/time issues.  The vibe was not enjoyable overall.  They forgot my husband's toast with his meal.  Also didn't tell us that each cup of coffee was a new charge/no refills.  My quinoa burger was good, but small, and not worth $12.  Bill came to $30 for two mediocre meals w poor service and lots of surrounding chaos.  Not sure if I'll be back...being able to operate efficiently when you're busy is a standard. It clearly wasn't happening on any level.  I do work hard for my money and dining out needs to be pleasurable and worth it. With that said, I'm not sure I'll be back here again. I may give it one more try to see how it goes for 3 out of 3.   Original review ***  Wow! I am beyond impressed with this place.  Came here for brunch on a Sunday afternoon, and I was sooo hungry. I was seated quickly & asked for a recommendation as it was my first time. Decided on the tofu scramble w nori, rice, & slaw. It was SO good, and made in a different way than the standard tofu scramble every other vegan friendly place makes. The flavors were amazing!  The chef also brought out a vegan rice pudding for me that was out of this world. He was very friendly, and I could tell he truly cares about his business and customers.  I had a great experience here and will definitely return.

OeValX8ZlsRTyqK8rfNIaA.text: Thanks yelpers - I'm glad I came. However, I wish I would have selected something else. The ambiance/decor was immediately welcoming so I was optimistic. I selected the eggs benedict...but was ultimately disappointed. Here's why. Muffin raw - not toasted, cool Eggs cooked medium/medium rare  - very runny, cool Bacon cooked only on one side (slab bacon is a challenge and should be avoided in this dish, IMO) Too much sauce - WOW!! About 3x too much sauce was used. Yikes!  Why 4 stars? Ambiance, friendliness, appreciation, care....I'm holding out that this was a fluke. Go there!

Etmu3MHbcIDQ9dxdgddXpg.text: Great food with excellent gourmet quality food. Everything we tried was excellent and stood out. The homemade chips, Mac and cheese, best clam chowder I've ever tried, Truly deserves 5 Stars

_eg_Q9k0naWdCTD9BTtsxA.text: Based on all the 5-star reviews, I decided to try this place. I had the Cobb salad and it was good but not much chicken. If there's enough chicken, I would be able to take the leftover home. Since it's just vegetables, I did not bother. I have tried Cobb salad at other restaurants and the chicken portion was much bigger in the Cobb salad. As far as the coffee, I am afraid to say it's the worst. My instant coffee at home is even way better.  Let's see some positive: they gave you some homemade potato chips while waiting for your food. They were really good, the best I have ever had. At the end, they gave you homemade fresh chocolate chips cookies. They were still soft and warm, felt like they just came out of the oven, good too but I couldn't finish the whole cookie since I was on a diet.

qMg-zsIx-9ry_5JKOjCNQg.text: This is the bloody best Cafe I've tried here in Vegas. The service was excellent, everything was served both on time and with a warm smile. The menu may not look extensive but everything on there is made of pure quality. I tried getting a picture of the avocado toast but my family wolfed it down in less than ten seconds straight. The glaze spouses perfectly. We also had the Eggs Benedict and the Smoked Salmon plate. The eggs were absolutely not overpowering or felt overtly spiced, as so many other places do. In addition, the potatoes  had a light but fun crisp to them, not oily at all. The smoked salmon plate comes with a lightly toasted bagel, and it reminds me more of a zen garden than a bagel plate; I'm pretty sure it got me one step closer to enlightenment. And the freshly made chocolate chips cookies, by God, they melt in your mouth. Overall, a lovely hidden gem in Vegas, will be back if possible.

I ordered the cinnamon roll, which came out looking amazing, but it was hard as a rock. When I told the manager about it, he said it should have been eaten while hot. This tells me that the roll wasn't fresh in the first place and had been nuked. They did give me another roll, which was better, but the experience was not positive.

70d3flD9sHw8o-k-T9dEDQ.text: When in Las Vegas one can follow the drunken hordes down the strip and wake up to a smoke filled casino buffet or average and seedy LV Strip restaurant to recover from the night before and wonder just what the f**k you did last night. OR one can take an Uber out to where the real people live and work and eat at Zenaida's. Cool atmosphere, great service, really great food, and reasonably priced.  The chicken & waffle is good post-party night fare and so is the hash and eggs, and so is pretty much everything else.  Next time I'm here and feeling like I have done wrong the previous evening I'm trying the breakfast burger.   Now, where did I leave my wallet last night and how am I gong to pay for this??? And, why am I wearing a Speedo?

PSf_ecI81X2FnEKCetv3uQ.text: Awesome food great service very friendly attentive great ambiance music jazz type music but the food is excellent avacado toast was to die for great Colombian coffee. We will be back get there early they close at 2 pm

aSwfEdf47sEadEEnzt7i5g.text: Zenaida's is my favorite breakfast joint in Las Vegas. The staff is always friendly and courteous.  We came in for brunch on July 1st, and were seated right away. The restaurant is a little warm, but it was not unbearable.   I ordered the chicken and waffles and my boyfriend ordered the Colin's Breakfast Burger.   My boyfriend stayed that the breakfast sandwich was decent, but there are better things on the menu that he would try before ordering the breakfast burger again. The chicken and waffles were okay. I think that the chicken and waffles I had in the past have always been a more meaty part of the chicken. The flavor and breading was good, I just think the chicken was a little too thin for my taste. It isn't a dish I would order again, but it doesn't deter me away from visiting Zenaida's again. I much prefer the biscuits and gravy that I had ordered on a previous visit.  The waiter also brought by a complementary basket of potato chips. They were so good!! Especially the aioli dipping sauce! I would put it on everything if I could! And of course at the end of the meal you always get the complimentary cookies that taste like they just came out of the oven.  The best part of Zenaida's is the customer service. The chef always comes to check in on guests to make sure that we are satisfied. We have this establishment bookmarked as a breakfast favorite! Thank you Zenaida's for the good food and wonderful customer service!

6jmFA_zw5LrAJOcaJJyOGw.text: I tried Zenaida's Cafe again several times in the last week and they are still fantastic. I enjoyed the Pork Stack, Corned Beef Hash and Monte Christo. They still serve complimentary homemade chips before the meal and a chocolate chip cookie at the end. The coffee was strong and hot. The service was timely and attentive without being intrusive. The chef took the time to ask whether I enjoyed his dishes. I wish this business every success and hope that they are earning enough. The portion sizes seem large for the price.

fq0LoXdmyg8uou3gMC-3yg.text: Everything from the cinnamon roll to the chicken and waffles with a side of grits!!! On point! The icing on the cake was the chef greeting at the end. Definitely will be back!

Every time we have been, the chef personally comes out to greet every guest in the restaurant and engage in conversation, time permitting. OwIOQhZjHZf3ezrJmg1yOg.text: Walking in to the restaurant you're greeted with homey decor. This gives a feeling of nostalgia like walking into grandma's house knowing you're about to eat well. The menu has a great selection ranging from daily made cinnamon rolls to clam chowder. We stumbled upon this place after an eye appointment and I'm glad my eye doctor is close by so it'll be a little treat to myself every time I get my eyes picked and prodded. I had the chicken and waffles while my husband built his own omelet. The food was delicious! After we had our meal they even gave us complimentary apple cobbler. Such a treat coming from such a cookie cutter town like Las Vegas it's nice to know that there's a hole in the wall that delivers excellent service and mouthwatering food!

-Y9yhq6A6L9-O5TC6WYxlw.text: Delicious food! I got the sterling breakfast. It was a basic, no frills breakfast, so I wasn't expecting much. That's not a knock on Zenaida's at all, I just typically like my breakfast pretty straight up: breakfast meet, eggs, potatoes, toast, and coffee. I was very much pleasantly surprised! The bacon is to die for and their breakfast potatoes are more than your average fair. The complimentary cookies at the end did not hurt at all :D

j9TjsImNlewDDczBp2uqLw.text: Outstanding food. So surprising ! Pleasant bright, colorful interior. Jazz /fusion type music in the background suit the decor. Greens for the avocado toast were delicious and seasoned differently than salad for other dishes. Delighted to see a fresh ripe fig on my plate. Also offers vegetarian dishes and I'll skip the quinoa burger and try the tofu dish next time. Complimentary cookies, but we would have highly rated Chef Sterling and this establishment anyway. . Agree w good customer service- our service was great.   We encountered this unassuming restaurant and are glad we did. Now it is your turn.

8oPIOlygeiUXBcmytDVS5Q.text: First try....Food is very good...Great service...Everything tastes Homemade...Very enjoyable and  birthday surprise from the Chef!

E4M9gfk7GE6yixChrau4ZQ.text: We decided to eat here because it's close to home. Their service was amazing from the moment we walked in to the moment we left. As soon as we were seated, we were served chips with an aioli sauce. They were amazing! I ordered the Zenaida's breakfast and my husband ordered the salmon dish. Both dishes were delicious. The pancakes were out of this world and even their coffee (decaf) was full of flavor and not watered down like most places. Before we left, we were offered a dessert. It was the best banana bread pudding I have EVER had!! We will definitely come back!

jJND94aL_kdrFj3F8kaT2w.text: Came here passing through, had such a great lunch! Our food was creative and incredibly delicious. The portion size was perfect, and cutely presented. You can tell the chef takes pride in his food, and was in the back creating new recipes. We had the avocado toast and a quinoa sandwich. Both excellent. If I lived here I would come all the time.

We ordered the Tofu Scramble (amazing!), banana pancakes (super delicious), the avocado toast (), and the chicken and waffles.  Bruh, all of it was incredible.  I don't want to sound like I'm over exaggerating, but it was awesome.  Great service, ambiance and menu was diverse.  The head chef/owner came to greet us and was super nice.  He made us some homemade chocolate chip cookies  This spot is a little bit off the beaten path, but I'd come back daily if I could.  Well worth the trip from strip, you will not be disappointed!

xnp8HZz8Mp8Z-91goN2-yg.text: The chef is so sweet!  I am allergic to shrimp and I wanted some grits, so the chef made mine with bacon instead.  It was sooo good!  Then he stopped by our table to check how we liked it!  How nice is that?!?

yDFUFUJV9EfyOY2jsSY0yQ.text: My boyfriend and I have been looking for a good shrimp and grits spot and this place takes the cake. Everything we tried tasted like mommas home cooking. So much effort went into making each dish and the service was speedy too. We always appreciate a place that has amazing food and makes you feel at home. Every person we encountered had a great attitude and was very attentive. We will definitely be back. I wish I could rate this place higher :) I hope they never change!

xGa975QMMQLeAvbk2ypdeA.text: Did not expect to like the food here as much as I did!!! Their waffles and bacon are so so good! I also loved the complimentary chips served in the beginning and complimentary cookies served to end our meal that tasted like heaven omggg! Their 5 star reviews are definitely well deserved!!!

qBwbKyoCZSnxeThWBVhc9Q.text: A small local place! The chef tends to know most of the people who visit. I have been here maybe two or three times. The burger is amazing :))) coffee is a plus. Plus you get a free cookie at the end of your meal, the cherry on top.

01zqs4mM9mKYq_w1wdR6hA.text: My boyfriend and I love getting brunch. It's the one thing in life worth getting up early for.  Zenaida's was a great pick because they have dishes for meat eaters and some vegetarian choices, as well. I'm talking well thought out items, not the usual afterthought dishes that you get from most establishments.   I was torn between the scrambled tofu dish with rice and the breaded/fried eggplant lettuce cups. I ended up ordering a dish off the weekly specials list, the Vegan Stack. Grilled onions and shredded potatoes were layered with two jerk-rubbed, grilled tofu steaks. Chopped tomatoes and red onion topped the stack for a good mix of raw and cooked veggies. Everything was well seasoned and full of flavor. The jerk spice made that dish.   During our meal, the chef stepped out to greet and thank us for joining them for breakfast. Along with the service from our sweet server, I'd say they provided us with an excellent overall dining experience.   After our meal, we were presented with two warm chocolate chip cookies, adorned with whipped cream and caramel drizzle, compliments of the chef. I cannot think of a sweeter gesture than this. The cookies were just the way I like them, soft and chewy; simple and comforting, all at once. The care and attention we received felt like we were dining at a family member's home. This little gem is the perfect reason to support local, independent businesses.

HJwmI7-6ZG2QpnPNHc9olQ.text: We had avocado toast; a burger and a traditional breakfast - eggs and potato's. They give you homemade potato chips. Everything was delicious. The avocado toast was amazing and the burger was too large to eat with your hands. The waitstaff is friendly; they have nice jazzy music. It's small and casual and relaxing. Leave the strip and come here. You won't regret it.

pCAgXHZbkPEJbIhivFaGpw.text: Amazing lunch spot close by my job. My boyfriend and I go to lunch once weekly here like clockwork. Service is impeccable. And the food is incredible. Plenty of healthy, flavorful options. Avocado toast is boss!

kDQjs8FL4vxcgRrSZoagtg.text: Zenaida's Cafe is a True gem! Whenever we are in Vegas we make it a priority to stop by as much as we can. The food is always made to perfection! You can really taste the love. We always have the same waiter, Jaime I believe was his name. He always takes great care of us! Chef Sterling always comes out to greet everyone and make sure everyone is having a great experience and tops it all off with  delicious complimentary cookies! Yelp really needs to have an option for 10 stars because 5 does not do this place justice!

HMw4DDPAFXaZl71oaJPbUQ.text: Some of the best service I have seen/experienced. The food is delicious. I am from out of town and always come back!

TRObuC5ccbmP-7z8GkH7VQ.text: Amazing food!  Chef Sterling really puts his all into his food and his menu.   He also comes around to each table and meetings with is customers.  And at the end he serves complementary cookies that are to die for!   Breakfast is out of this world and lunch is right there with breakfast.

kgcLBmpcD5D51u8O5EK1Xg.text: Enjoyed breakfast for the first time on 01/20/18 and we were pleasantly surprised by this great little breakfast joint in our hood!  We were given complimentary homemade potato chips with aioli (really aioli, not just commercial mayonnaise mixed with stuff) upon arrival/after ordering and they were pretty good. We ordered shrimp and grits, biscuits and gravy, and chicken and waffles. The grits were sooo cheesy (just the way we like 'em) and the gravy was delicious and made the dish rich. Biscuits were fluffy and although the gravy had a different taste than what we were accustomed to (a little sweet with some seasoning I didn't recognize), the spicy sausage really made the dish come together and balanced out the sweetness of the gravy. The waffle was fluffy and moist, not hard and dry like a lot of other places! The chicken was lightly battered and had great flavor, too. Also loved the caramel sauce on top of the chicken and waffles.  After our meals were finished, they brought out complementary fresh baked cookies-- honestly as a pregnant woman this sealed the deal for me to return! They were still warm from the oven, soft, and gooey.   Thank you, we will be back!!!!

WkCJ0Zstn2qIfgbksCmeNA.text: Avocado toast was delicious. Bacon was thick and juicy! No photos because we gobbled it all before I got to it... the homemade chantilly cinnamon rolls are a must try. Decadent cookies at the end (chef's treat) were fab! Thanks, chef!

s2YmZqH-CQt9mjXvV8mEgw.text: I was looking for some place new to try out for brunch with my fiance. Stumbled upon Zenaida's Cafe on Yelp and saw all the great reviews. The reviews were spot on! As soon as we walked in we were greeted and seated right away. I ordered the waffles with bacon and my fiance ordered the biscuits and gravy. He swears up and down that it was THE BEST biscuits and gravy he's ever had. (Even better than his grandmothers, lol) The waffles were wonderful. The homemade whipped cream is what made it to die for. The service was impeccable and we even got served complimentary homemade chips and cookies from the chef! The chef here really knows what he's doing and him and the staff will definitely see us again and again!

ryIq6gx_fKHbEpQZTuM2LQ.text: My family and I keep coming in for breakfast for delicious food and warm hospitality. We love this place!

ui8rrYPjnmvOgF7kOjdu-A.text: Loved the food!  Nice take on a turkey burger. Husband loved the Mac N' Cheese. Ready to go back to try something different.

E89jB_UfRxsBClz7lcmEhQ.text: delicious, great service and the special compliments of the chef app and desserts were to die for.  definitely will be back and definitely worth the drive from iron mtn/jones!

-GWNEUG9i6q44Pazx5l_HA.text: This place is ahhhmazing. Its a quaint little place with all the gourmet flavors you could ever want. When you first arrive you are greeted immediately...we had a party of 7 i was surprised they got us seated within 5 min. Once we got to our table they took our drink orders... Shortly thereafter they took our food orders ,..while we waited for our food to arrive they brought us free homemade potato chips with a homemade aioli sauce... The sauce was so good my 2 year old grandson tore it up and he can be a picky eater. They also gave us a complimentary avocado toast because another party ordered it inadvertently. It was delicious.. Avocado was fresh..ripe cherry tomatoes ..only wish we had a little more of that balsamic vinegar they splashed on top... My shrimp and grits arrived. Omgoodness it was scrumptious.. And there was plenty of grits i had enough to bring home for dinner. My party also ordered the clam chowder if you like meaty hearty clams this is definitely the meal to get... Everyone in our party was pleasantly happy with their order. As a grand finale they served each of us a pumpkin bread pudding with a side of whipped topping... It was definitely a delightful ending to our meal. My boyfriend doesnt like pumpkin and even he ate the entire dessert. The chef personally approached us to thank us for coming. Customer service was top notch. I gave this place 5 stars ...the only thing i think they could work on is making sure all the food comes to the table at the same time. My daughter waited about 10 mins after we were served for her chicken wings to arrive.other than that they are top notch.. My family and i will definitely be coming back!!

2FM2aqIqVAw7cLa3QnWZLQ.text: Not your ordinary restaurant. A good selection of food all prepared in a unique way. Wait staff friendly and on the ball. It offers upscale food at everyday prices.

esaq8Wx48QkoUrL3hViQwA.text: great food.  great srvice.  the chef, Sterlong was amazing.  actaully came out and checked on every single guest.  nobody does that anymore.  that is some next level ser ice right there!  i got a smoked salmon omlet.  cooked perfectly!  they had capers!!  awesome!  capers may or may not be your thing, but just the fact that they had them is amazing.

LUDu320Jp6fg2iffwfjkrg.text: This place is a hole-in-a-wall GEM!!! Amazing staff great atmosphere and of course the FOOD!!! Holy amazing Batman try the corned beef hash chef whim style simply amazing. Hit all the senses and tastebuds not to mention very perfect portion of potato, where others put the hash on a bed of potatoes, they put them as a supporting role!!! ijz7MmUvVPs6lFbvMEVhQg.text: Looking for a breakfast place to eat at besides casinos and hit the jackpot. Food is fabulous the staff is great

wWesvjF7Ygg3Hv4QfDWm_A.text: At a loss for words.  This is EXACTLY what we have been missing on the East Side. aSOY_5oxmwqviaXnXRbgHA.text: The Eggs Benedict were delicious and  Service was excellent and personalized with the chef visiting with each guest to ensure their satisfaction.  We will be visiting this restaurant again soon!

LUlpkdW10f29QfbeT9eB9Q.text: This place is great. I generally dont write reviews, but I have to give this one five stars. We have been here four times, and every time we were very impressed. Give it a try!  You wont be disappointed.

gxGW5xk2JGxGwaTQvuTBOg.text: Where do I start with this place? They say first impressions are everything and as soon as you walk in the door you are welcomed like family. This place really gets it and what I mean by that is the welcoming atmosphere, the smooth playing jazz, the at home feel to the restaurant and great food and a wonderful family running this place.  After your your 2nd visit you will feel like you have known the Chef since childhood. Very personable, available, outgoing and just an all around great guy and incredible Chef. When I say incredible don't let that be an understatement as you will see things on his menu and try it and more than likely it will be the best version you ever tried. He is passionate about his craft like a Michael Jordan and has a class and charisma of a Frank Sinatra. He  is a savant in his profession and has some of the best food you will ever eat anywhere on earth. Trust me I have been everywhere. On top of all that he will feed you like an old Italian Grandma would whether you order it or not it will be coming your way he is very giving and even when your stuffed you'd be crazy not to indulge in what he sends out to you. This is a wonderful place and if you go there you will become a regular. I can't say enough about this place other than they have great food and this Family really gets it which is a rarity in the times we live in.  You won't find a better meal in Vegas for the cost's as he is serving food that places on the strip would charge you $40 or $50 a plate for and his is better. Come check it out i'm sure you'll agree this is the best little gem in Vegas.

tdKtrNB7f3sPhCa6RWF_yg.text: Just go and check it out... you won't be disappointed. The Sunday morning jazz music in the back round and the amazing food is well worth trying.

wc48PWWzISXoqlh9E1i16g.text: Loveeeee this place ! Chef is always on point . Servers are fast ! Food is bombbbbbbbb

7VcdrGEUSYtjrG5fKkyq8A.text: Had our first visit this morning - it won't be our last!!!  Service was great, staff warm and welcoming and the food was OUTSTANDING !!!  Their motto of 'just good food' is spot on.   Be sure to try the avocado toast, Cinnamon roll, or breakfast burrito - all are soooooo yummmmmmy !!

GxDZE-nXOvNnWqSqYqw2dw.text: We had been wanting to try Zenaida's Cafe for a while and finally made it. What a nice breakfast! Service was friendly and the restaurant itself gave off a neat jazz vibe. My partner ordered the Breakfast Burrito and he is still raving about the homemade salsa. So good! I had their version of the Monte Cristo. It was an excellent breakfast sandwich but it really has nothing to do with a Monte Cristo...I'd call it a Cuban Breakfast Sandwich. Very good, don't get me wrong! We look forward to returning soon so we can try their lunch items.

Y3V7JSwlD3WOJ9YXX0wVjA.text: This is probably the best cafe restaurant in Las Vegas. I ordered the chicken and waffles, especially the cinnamon roll was really good and had great texture. The service are really friendly and hardworking.

HFcMbm8AcLayzJAnIPdXMQ.text: A friend told us about Zenaida's with glowing reviews.  We then checked it out here on Yelp and almost every review was 5 stars, so we had to try it for breakfast/lunch.  A little hidden gem of a place, tough to find but worth it.  Many things on the menu interested us.  I had the eggs benedict which was as good and she had a special of brie omelete.  Very unique and good.  I know that seems enough for many to give them 5 stars but while the meal was good, the service fast and courteous it was not so outstanding but well worth trying.  Next time I am getting chicken and waffles.

cqQQV8v29qVWjxh39myyLg.text: Very cool little cafe. Clean restaurant. Very good food and service ! We will be going back.

os2XMa7Omc4v9oD74pyE5g.text: I got the shrimp and grits but there was so much more I wanted to get. Grits were great! The service was a little slow to start but great after we were seated. The chef came out to ask how our food was. In addition, we got complimentary cookies that were warm. Really liked this place, a hidden gem, definitely going back when I'm in the area!

Ro-ac7Gs6p-ERbEsn0LVsA.text: The place we were headed didn't open for 20 minutes so we saw Zenaida's was open. Very cute storefront restaurant.   You can see into the kitchen and even listen to the chef give instructions.  That was kinda cool.   He was instructing the line on the quality he expected!  Nice upbeat instrumental music playing.   We got a warm greeting and seated immediately.  Just about everything on the menu looked awesome.  I decided on pancakes and my husband had biscuits and gravy.   But first one of the servers brought out homemade potato chips with a red pepper aioli. That was really yummy!!  The pancakes were really yummy and hallelujah somebody that knows how to cook pancakes!  I am so tired of getting half cooked pancakes!  My husband liked his biscuits and gravy.   The gravy wasn't what he expected since is was a brown gravy instead of light.   But it was really tasty. Oh I forgot to mention SUPER fast service!  Then at the end, our server brought us two little bites of pumpkin bread pudding complements of the chef.  It was really yummy as well. I just love little touches like that.  Really makes you feel like they appreciate their customers. Well done!  And as we leave the chef says thanks, goodbye and Happy New Year through the pass window!

howjXQ3SXUnlwBB8h0cAmQ.text: Great breakfast and perfect  cooked eggs.  Chef personally came to talk to us.  It is a really hidden gem in Vegas.  Recommended.

yq_gp4zEeROn88jXZfFRYA.text: They have 2 vegan dishes (tofu scramble with jasmine rice & a quinoa sandwich). My friend & I ordered both & I really enjoyed the tofu scramble, it was so well seasoned! The quinoa sandwich came with a salad that had a homemade dressing we really liked. The waiter was super friendly & the chef checked on us to make sure we were enjoying our meal. When he found out I was vegan he made my friend & I a non dairy parfait w/ fruit. Everyone was so friendly & accommodating. Id go back just for the service & thoughtfulness.

gBvqVjr28lxWj--gfCNnBw.text: So this attractive woman invites me out to eat brunch here with her. I don't know anything about this place but I figure what the heck... who am I to refuse an offer from a pretty woman! Anyways, we get to the restaurant and she orders the Tofu Scramble and I order the Eggs Benedict. The Eggs Benedict will look like your average Eggs Benedict but boy were they different! I don't know what type of sauce they used on the eggs but man, it was like crack. One bite and I was hooked! The eggs were made perfectly and the bacon on the Eggs Benedict was cooked just right! My date's tofu scramble wasn't half bad either. It was good but we both came to the conclusion that we are both carnivores because meat was the only thing that could have made that dish better! But as stated, it was still good. All in all I had a very well wonderful time eating here. There was good food, good atmosphere and of course, great company! 5 stars all the way!

j0iJl-O1DyMTqqoJzqYWFw.text: This place is a diamond in the rough! Once word gets out, it's going to be packed. The food is simply delicious.  The flavors are unique and well worth coming back for. They start you off with homemade chips that are crisp and addicting. We had the Tofu scramble and the corn beef hash Benedict. They even finish you off with a tasty treat before you leave.  We're coming back for sure.

They were really good, felt like the aioli was missing something but I didn't need it anyway. We both ordered omelettes-they were fluffy and hot. So I had eggs and cheese. It was ok. I did point it out and they sent out some warm cookies for us.  Overall it was good, I enjoyed the jazz music playing. It was comfortable and the people were nice. Don't know that this is my go to breakfast place though. Solid 3 stars.

Chef comes out to check in everyone. Great menu with superb variety sure to please anyone. We went on a Sunday morning around 930am and there was no wait. The food - delicious! I had the egg benedict, it was very tasty with very thick bacon. I couldn't eat all the bacon. Hubby and son had the breakfast burrito and cinnamon roll. They said the burrito was very good and could see why this place gets 5 stars. The cinnamon roll is very sweeet with frosting, whipped cream and strawberries on top. If I'm in Vegas again, I would come back...otherwise, Zenaida's, feel free to come to California!

plQMNWJSBXp6KxmhH0zE_Q.text: Just found this little treasure.  Great chef, great food, went there for brunch.  Perfect with tons of free parking.  Will be back.

REVGPQPXtXkd-JLmQ2GDHA.text: Shrimp and grits and a side of eggs were GREAT! However the side of bacon I ordered was entirely too thick. I'm a bacon lover and crispy bacon is life. Please invest in regular bacon and cook it crispy and you got a forever customer!

xzqNZgbp0zv-wImDV7pFeg.text: We had the avocado toast and eggplant stacks!! So yummy! The eggplant doesn't have bread so it's a nice low carb option. Cute little cafe for a quick and delicious breakfast.

PnI0-cI0WGAwYpTKuhiAnA.text: Awesome place with awesome food! Great customer service you won't be sorry you've tried this place!!! Thank you!!!

The food is incredible while the chef will make the rounds insuring the customers are happy.  My son who is vegan was accommodated without fail and I had the amazing eggs benedict for my Fathers Day breakfast,  I cannot say enough about this place other than everyone should celebrate this place and the chef  as the best breakfast in the city.   Its not just a pile if cheese and grease that you cannit finish,   this is a top level meal with great service at reasonable prices.

4xUcHnYUkUQIEaCmvFA4Ow.text: Sorry I could only give 5 stars this place is really fantastic.  I had the sirloin hash with ailoi sauce and Bleu cheese topped with 2 eggs, the dish was creative and delicious.  My wife had the eggs Benedict and they were heavenly.  Service was awesome.  Chef comes out and greets each table and thanks his guests for coming to his restaurant.  You can't go wrong with this choice.

tLzyAqOVf2t_nB5NYMnvJQ.text: My husband asked me this morning "where is your favorite breakfast place?", to which I replied "I don't really have one"...well I do now! This place is great! Great service, great food, you can tell the chef takes his job seriously! I had the avocado toast with a side of potatoes, and my husband had the salmon plate...all was well prepared and delicious!

Dg33GO1FUCuc4r08U9d1-A.text: Burrito built for two.  Head chef very nice.  Good service.  Friendly sax music grew on us.

9MQHkJPVZo2kVP2kEs-aKQ.text: This is quickly and justifiably losing its status as a hidden gem. Chef Sterling's charming little restaurant at Pecos and Tropicana is worth the 10 minute drive from the south strip. The food was superb and carefully prepared. My wife noticed that each ingredient of her egg white omelette seemed to have been prepared individually before being incorporated into the omelette. Chef Sterling confirmed that when he came out to chat with us. My bacon was incredible; hand cut from the ham. Everything about the place reflects the chef's commitment to excellence and customer service. If you're a Vegas visitor, do yourself a favour and experience this unique restaurant. If you're a local, I envy you.

Wg9tKCDtLLIZZbHGfTRNvg.text: I am not going to lie - I wasn't thrilled with my food experience. Today was finally the day that I went out on a limb and broke my keto diet. After reading all of the great Yelp reviews, I decided to give Zenaida's a shot.  I ordered Tremaine's Biscuits & Gravy. I have found a great love for freshly baked buttery biscuits in flavorful country gravy in recent months. And unfortunately, I found today's dish to be lacking in flavor. The biscuits were dry and the country gravy tasted like it was missing something. I added a little salt in hopes that it would bring the flavors to life; however, that did not work out as I was hoping. The dish came with four sausages - which were very flavorful and easily my favorite part of the dish. In my opinion, it was short of average and not worth the $10 price tag.  I had very high hopes for Zenaida's after reading all the amazing Yelp reviews and I ended up a little disappointed. I would definitely be willing to give Zenaida's Cafe a second chance - but maybe next time a different dish...

I ordered the Monte Cristo that was incredibly delicious, home style potatoes were amazing, chef still makes attempts to stop at every table to say hi. Nice mix of items in the menu, not an overwhelming amount of breakfast items like some places...what they do, they do well.  Portions were large... breakfast burrito was a mouthful...and delicious. I1_YaDWJk_6Cgh0fGmZaWw.text: I really liked this place. My mom and I wanted to have a light late lunch. I checked around yelp for salads and Zanaidas came up. She ordered a salad and I had the BLTA sandwich. Mine had bacon, lettuce, tomato and Avocado. It was served on grilled french bread and came with potato salad. This potato salad was the 2nd best I've ever had (second only to my own ). The sandwich had thick, tasty bacon. I traded half my sandwich for some salad which was delish. The BEST part was after we finished our waiter brought us 2 chocolate chip cookies compliments of the chef...THEE BEST EVERRR! They were warm, the chocolate inside was gooey and ..there was a drizzle of icing and some melted butter..UNREAL! SOOOO MMMM!! I'll be back. Thanks guys!

Vw7lZKd_uYIYIPFFKa_X7A.text: Wow!  On our way to the Grand Canyon we decided to pick a restaurant that was local.  We are huge fans of supporting local small restaurants.  I'm shocked this place doesn't have thousands of reviews.    Waffles - wow!  They smelled fabulous and were amazing.  The whipped topping and strawberries created the perfect profile.  Avocado toast - everyone must eat this.  The perfectly thin sliced garlic toast with avocado, tomato and pickled onions created the most delectable flavor profile.  I ordered this as my meal and couldn't finish it all.   My son doesn't care to eat very early so he ordered hash browns and they made some special just for him.  How nice!  My husband had the breakfast sandwich and he loved it.    This restaurant is amazing.  If you are in the area you must try it.

The food took forever, about half an hour. If it was busy I can understand it'll take a bit longer but not a lot of patrons during this time. I've ordered a side of bacon and it was burned. My wife ordered fried chicken and the chicken was bland, no taste. Strawberry served on my plate wasn't fresh or edible. JiJWOXwPK45OmiD1GbrkHg.text: I've been trying to come here for a while since I've heard lots of good things about this place, but it's kind of hard with it closing at 2 pm. The food here is good and the service was excellent. The servers were very attentive and the Chef even gave us a complimentary dessert. It was a pumpkin bread dessert that we ate up real fast. We ordered the Shrimp and Grits, thick cut bacon, and the Monte Cristo  Shrimp and Grits: This dish was good. The grits weren't overcooked or over seasoned and had a lot of cheese in them. There was also a good amount of shrimp on the plate and came with over easy eggs.  This dish had way too much sauce on the plate, which kind of took over the buttery and cheesy flavor of the grits. Less sauce and this would be almost perfect.   Monte Cristo: This was a really good breakfast sandwich. The eggs were nice and runny and the bread was not soggy. The potatoes were nice and soft on the inside and crispy on the outside.  Bacon: I wish I would've ordered more of this. Nothing better than extra thick cut bacon.

eipzmLuWedWiwNnle9Gpbg.text: What a phenomenal place. A True hidden gem! We had the corned beef hash and the salmon plate, both were incredible. The salmon plate was heaped with generous portions of salmon, chopped egg, capers, green and red onions, and about a pound of cream cheese - but the surprise hit was the smear of mustard to go with it all. A True classic expertly perfected.  The corned beef had a more delicate flavor than I'm used to in this over-salted world, and was just the perfect amount of flavor to go with the shredded hash browns and the scallion hollandaise sauce with 2 over-easy eggs. The dish was served piping hot, and I had a hard time not finishing the half I promised to share with my girlfriend.   Two cookies, compliments of the chef (who came out to check on us and who, by the way, opened the Wynn as Executive Chef!) was the perfect way to end this delightful meal. We will be back, and will be recommending this place to everyone we know!

87gPOMzTlfqbr0GOoA753Q.text: This Cafe is one of the reasons why I love Yelp so much. I would have never found it if it wasn't out of curiosity on why this little cafe, in a neighborhood I'm normally not in, had almost 105 star reviews. Also, with a name like Zenaida's, I would have assumed it was another Mexican style restaurant in Las Vegas. But what it is, is a fabulous fusion of bistro meets new American meets comfort-food.   The staff is so friendly and welcoming. You really do feel like you're part of a cool family that knows how to cook really well. The atmosphere is kind of kitschy and funky. And the little extras that they give you, like the homemade potato chips with aioli at the beginning to the meal and the cookies with cream at the end, really makes it special.   It's really kid friendly as well. My girlfriend brings her baby and the staff always googles over her and brings her little animal crackers or fruit to enjoy. We never asked for it they are just Johnny-on-the-spot and appears like magic. I highly recommend you check it out  for brunch . Their breakfast and brunch menu is definitely my favorite.
