The Benedict and breakfast burrito got great reviews from my friends, and my standard eggs and potatoes just what I wanted. The breakfast potatoes are the little squares, which is what I prefer, and they are great with the special aioli.   Overall, great value and pleasant experience!

FVCDE3U7C3DiF9p6z45Hrg.text: Great place and the service was exceptional! It's not every day you have several staff members check up on you, including the Chef himself! Excellent, will definitely be back!!!' Thank  you!

Vw3xnVR03ERVE9_UTYPN2g.text: Zenaida where have you been all of my life?? Well, all of my 13 yrs & 5 mos in LV.  It seems that I'm on a never-ending quest to find that quaint little local breakfast/brunch place that is simultaneously no frills and spectacular. Also, said place must not be overrun. A hidden gem, if you will.  There are a million breakfast and brunch options in this town and most of them are doing a fine job. Few are going above and beyond. Zenaida's is one of the few.  I don't go out for breakfast all that often, despite most of my bookmarks being for breakfast places. I love breakfast. I'm just not too keen on the that side of noon. So, when I am going out to breakfast it becomes a big decision as to where to go. I had had Zenaida's bookmarked for a while, and only put it on my to try list because it was close by with 5 stars on Yelp.   When we arrived we received a warm greeting. We were instructed to sit anywhere we liked. Within a few minutes the server took our drink order and while she was gone to get them, a 2nd server stopped to make sure she had been over and drinks were on the way. It made me feel like they had a lot of team mentality to ensure the customer was always taken care of.  We weren't super hungry so we decided to share a cinnamon roll & the chicken in waffles. After we ordered they brought is house made chips with a bloody Mary aoli. Honestly, I can't think of any other breakfast places with give you something like this at breakfast. Plus, it was really delicious. I don't even like aoli, but I was all over this. The chips we're fantastic.   My husband is a bit of a cinnamon roll connesieur, and this one did not disappoint! Not only was this cinnamon roll fresh and delicious, but it had a beautiful presentation that I just wasn't expecting from a little whole in the wall breakfast place. Every time I go to Zenaida's, this will be a must. Fresh baked & served warm.  The chicken & waffles, which aren't normally my thing, we're also great. I like my chicken crispy and this was crispy with a hint of sweetness. The waffle tasted great, but I would have preferred that to be crispy as well, and it was more on the cakey side.  As a special treat, we were given warm gooey chocolate chip cookies from the chef at no charge. A completely unexpected, but extremely appreciated surprise. They were amazing.  While we ate, I was listening to the next table over talking about Zenaida's food. It appeared to be a family of 1/2 locals and 1/2 visiting from parts unknown. The locals were raving about the food and said their Mac n Cheese "the most decadent thing you'll ever eat".  I don't know why I dragged my feet checking this place out, but I've been fantasizing about that cinnamon roll, and I can't wait to go back.  Zenaida's is clean, the food is great, and the service is outstanding.

_mIJiG8cVuf_6APNDQNkYA.text: We live pretty local to this restaurant and I've eaten here a hand full of time (more than 5 less than 10). The food here is very good but the service is always slow and less than desirable.  Today reached an all time low in customer service and I have decided to never eat here again.  We came here and brought my mother-in-law and rest of our family (party of 5) who was in town and my mother-in-law who is 80+ years and has trouble standing and walking. We walked in and there were 3 tables occupied, a few tables dirty and a few tables set and ready to go. The older thin gentleman with the spiked gray hair came up to the counter and told us there would be a 10 minute wait to be seated because he needed time to get caught up. I was a bit taken a back by his statement as the customer had to wait because he needed to get "caught up from the rush". I had to get a chair for my mother-in-law to sit while we waited to be seated in the virtually empty restaurant. After waiting he ended up sitting us a table that was already setup and ready to go when we walked in. I watched him whisper something to the server who took care of our table and I knew it was about us because she turned around to look directly at us. Needless to say the service was even worse than normal from her as well. From now on I will take my business and my family to a place that values the customers.

0Frcoe_BIh9-USxrQpPP6w.text: Well I must be missing something guys. From start to finish it was just ok. Chicken and waffles were average, the waffles tasted a bit doughy but the chicken breast( chicken fingers) were seasoned well.  I specifically asked if they were chicken fingers and was told no it was chicken breast. I asked for a side of jalapeno bacon however I couldn't get it because it only goes with the shrimp and grits. They did send out a side of the regular slab bacon complimentary(?) while I appreciate the gesture I would have gladly paid for the jalapeno bacon.  The jazz music was great, the chef came out and talk to every table......except ours  I'm a foodie and would have loved to chat ( the restaurant was not busy).  We travel  a lot and for me when I go to an independent restaurant the little things bring me back. This spot was just not for me.

Wwb2NnGrfe2Bxjhtd_Ze2w.text: My wife and I were delighted to find this local gem!  As breakfast fanatics, we routinely scour yelp for new and interesting places, and Zenaidas easily makes the cut. A great number of delicious entrees was available, we enjoyed Salmon Bagel Plate, Z's Montecristo and a Bacon Benedict - all of which were outstandingly good and generously proportioned.  We're already plotting our return!

LmciJW6bVCRZwD5TFd-6bQ.text: Don't let this place slip by! Everything is fresh and tasty. The variety is great for those looking to eat light, meat free, or do the whole nine yards and stuff your face. The staff is friendly and helpful. It's got a definite mom and pop feel to it.  The Avocado Toast is the bees knees & the fresh greens are a perfect topper. I got Chloe's Tofu Scrambled, let me tell you what, THEY MAKE TOFU SO STINKING GOOD. My dad got the Fried Chicken and Waffle: it was a HUGE portion and HE LOVED IT LOOOOOOOVED IT.  The chef even came over and gave us a little sample of his bananas foster and thanked us for coming in! What a sweetheart.

6C12Cbfp2csuKRyAuWu1dA.text: Casual and inexpensive. I had tomato bisque for a light lunch. $4.95 (I think). The chef sent out a cup of his chicken noodle soup also because he was proud of it. Both were delicious. The only thing wrong was the place is empty. Cmon....come over here. Trop and Pecos near Taco y Taco and the Eagle.

732xtMAvwOVCKir9ldz5Qw.text: The food, the chef and the rest of the staff are great. We were in Henderson at an expensive resort for a high school reunion and wanted to go someplace else for breakfast. We found Zenaida's on Yelp and 9 of us went there to try it out. I won't go in to all the dishes, because everyone ordered something different, but suffice it to say that they were all great and plentiful. We liked it so much we went back the next day again and brought another 7 classmates with us for a total of 16 of us. Everyone enjoyed their food. The chef came out and talked to us afterwards bringing hot, homemade chocolate chip cookies with amazing whipped cream of all of us on the house. Their special menu those two days was amazing with a variety of Eggs Benedict and omelets. The biscuit and gravy with sausage would have fed several. All of us would go back if given the chance to be back in that area.

9j-CNGjHSo9R_mHiT7mJyw.text: Had he winter salad. It was delicious. What a nice find while here doing a class. The service was wonderful and the ambience is cool. They even brought me a fresh cookie from the chef after my meal. Five stars all the way

4PF8vupQOzDcd6Z5YnsgYQ.text: Absolutely amazing breakfast.  Everything ordered was cooked perfectly and was delicious.  The avocado toast was delicious and this will be my favorite Las Vegas brunch spot.

_rLhI47jwqdCqvE_WE6EeQ.text: Came in for the first time today. I ordered the avocado toast and a side of breakfast potatoes, the husband ordered egg, bacon and potatoes. The avocado toast came with arugula and a balsamic drizzle. It was awesome and just enough food. Didn't need the potatoes, even though they were good. The bacon was thick slab full of smoky flavor! I ordered a cinnamon roll to take home and it was delicious. Chef gave us some warm chocolate chip cookies and they were just perfect. We will be back and will bring people with us. Thank you for the great food!

fzcz_OtsTg_SF0eQK2-r8w.text: Really high level food (and a fair amount of it), especially for the price. You can tell there is a lot of care and pride taken in what they serve - which is what separates a decent place from a spectacular one. Plus - weekly specials, which means you won't be bored coming back.

dMGVrHQ-5AK2hz70LLVHxQ.text: Wow, totally deserving of 5 stars!  We got the Eggs Benedict and the Corned Beef Hash and both were absolutely delicious.  The coffee was hot and our server kept it filled.  She was polite, attentive, and knowledgeable about the menu.  The chef came out to ask each guest about their experience and thanked them for coming in.  They even served us free chips/dip as an appetizer and free shortcake dessert with whipped cream and berries!

ateWsCBDI21UPcd94sMUqg.text: Holy cow! This place is a hidden gem! Excellent food, great service, very friendly chef. Highly recommend this place.

iWWJWAWopX87swt65xxBqQ.text: This is an awesome place. We were searching for something good and casual for our food and away from the all you can eat buffets and found this on yelp. Nice little place, good decor. Food is prepared with lot of care. Even the plates are designed for the dish you order. I like that detail. I had scrambled tofu breakfast. It was really good, ingredients go very well with each other. Very good presentation, and delicious food. Service is very good. Don't be alarmed if the place is not house full, it is away from downtown. It is True to their tag line, "just good food ".

63GFrYapF7rLV0PhZ85sMA.text: Holy f****** s*** this place is the s***. Who knew biscuits and gravy would taste so gourmet. Very nice retro and groovy place. Nice jazz music in the background and wonderful employees. Every time I've been there the chef has always came out and greeted us. Free dessert occasionally too!

hBQNRf-Hnyw6PK9tr2RnjQ.text: Went their rrcently.  Out of towners found this cafe with friendly service and great food.

qtLOFRcgdIP6Nn48pyW1bw.text: I was in Las Vegas for the AKA Leadership Conference.  My girlfriend highly recommended this restaurant. A group of us decided to go, and it was the best food we had while in Vegas. The meal was reasonably priced, actually I expected it to be more. We had so much food we had take out boxes. St the end if the meal the Chef surprised us with Ambrosia  If you go to this restaurant, you will not be disappointed. The chef and staff were so attentive to us. JRlJ4k3-68OPEOKbqcLK1Q.text: This place is AMAZING great atmosphere, delicious food, best service. Soothing music in the back ground. I can not stress enough how good the food was!

EvNP_F5UWbVC68PZsjN3Lw.text: We came because this place had great Yelp reviews and we were not disappointed! This place has great ambiance, kind and attentive servers, amazing food presentation, and great food. We started with some complementary garlic chips and sauce, and were beyond impressed with the quality of our food. We mentioned the free coffee and it was brought right out. The chef came out to talk to all the tables and make sure everyone was enjoying their food, then served hot apple cobbler as a complimentary dessert at the end of the meal. Best place for breakfast in the area, hands down

-cfNDvai4HwhEBMIAzSEFg.text: Unbelievable food, anything I write will not do it justice. You have to experience it. Best food in vegas period.

l5sxzWAMaq6zkFD54pmfdQ.text: Awesome service and food! Sterling Burpee and his family have created a gem. Will definitely be back!

4z-xUYBjdyEGjr_GvN2oBA.text: Great spot for a quick breakfast! Not much of a coffee shop more a sit down and have a meal kind of place.!

4IHGbKnYe_k_Ax5lkKE5-A.text: So I have to say food is 5 stars. We arrived and waited, no problem. When we were seated she asked what we wanted to drink. Water, easy. 15 min later no water, no waitress. She passed by and hubby told her we were ready. She walked to another table that was seated after us and took their order. Ok waited long enough, we walked out. Have to admit that is was gutsy on the owners part to chase us down at our car and beg us to give them another try. We did. Again food was awesome, spot on. We had the avocado toast, which was great. I had eggs benedict, very yummy. Hubby had the corned beef, homemade. The minus star is for the growing pains. I hate bad food, but bad service is no fun either. The owners were great. Someone else was not happy and went out yelling. The owner said they can't keep up with the growth and will be hiring more people. We drove from the strip and it was worth it. We will be back.

8IeOM0HRuDDgv4OQdz8dgQ.text: Vegas's best kept secret!  Definitely recommend eating here!!  Great food and presentation.  The Chef takes pride in his cooking!  All four entrees that we had were excellent.  Earned all five stars!!

6lwyqx8MVcseacDdqX_4jQ.text: We've been going to Zenaida's for about a year now and have made our way through about half of the menu and most of the specials they offer and have loved every meal. The staff always makes you feel welcome and the chef has come out to say Hi every time we've been there. The fact that we've been given a free warm cookie dessert at every visit doesn't hurt either. The only complaint I have is that I wish there were a few more healthier and lighter options. Sometimes we choose to eat other places because we're just not in the mood for such a heavy meal. But that's about me, not them. Everything they do they do perfectly.

NY0ih2bLgb70VTDusrt6FQ.text: We went to Zenaida's for breakfast as a result of their first review and we were not disappointed! This nicely decorated restaurant has the opportunity to become one of those neighborhood "go to" places for breakfast and lunch.  They offered an excellent selection of items that are priced well for the quality and quantity of food.  I selected an omelette and was able to choose the ingredients to customize it to my taste.  I was presented with perfectly prepared breakfast including excellent potatoes, toast and a side of fruit.  The quality of the ingredients was top notch including an a very tasty thick piece of applewood bacon adorning the top. Nice touch and very flavorful.  Please do yourself and the neighborhood a favor and try this restaurant. I would love to see them to grow and expand to dinner.

zLHty1CLmTl7W0LEyGE8-Q.text: Chef and his entire staff are awesome. I have been back there several times, and I have never been disappointed with my food!!! Great Job! I will see you soon...

08XcGt37q5SP_7Xvanrotg.text: The food was amazing! My father has dietary restrictions and the chef made him something special off the menu with eggplant and seafood. The chef was wonderful and accommodating.

o3wZAOgXYFJQdpguXBKhRA.text: This place is BOMB! The Eggs Benedict was the best I've ever had! Good people, good service, all around an excellent place! Surprised with some yummy homemade chips with aioli to start and ambrosia to finish things up. Seriously go here...  you will not be disappointed.

cEQZLzwDIf7LY9oz7A_FdA.text: We're in town temporarily, decided to give this place a try and was not disappointed.  The decor was nice, even though small it was cozy. Servers were very nice & very efficient. The menu had a pretty good variety of dishes to choose from that it made it difficult to decide, but in a good way! We decided on shrimp & grits, a burger & fries and crispy chicken wings & fries. They were all really good choices & the pumpkin bread pudding that was offered for dessert was awesome! Loved it!  We'll definitely be back!!

Z0oIe9rjcMTG3JN962tZxg.text: Went on a Sunday morning at about 11 or breakfast. Got right in. Very friendly staff! Service was great as well. We both had the Eggs Benedict and it was perfect! The slab cut bacon was phenomenal! Hollandaise was the best I have ever had! The chef came by to say hello and was extremely friendly and fun to talk to. Worth the trip from the far north side of town! We'll go back. Or hopefully they bring one to the North end!

WQ-YQAbQWvy9uMiRBQJzvw.text: I loved loved this place. I am a vegan and we just dropped by last minute. The chef went out of his way to create vegan options. His family has vegan and vegetarian members. The most delicious vegan squash soup, tofu scramble, and quinoa burger.

MmPxKKm2Bsx0qEbSSVgNjw.text: Outstanding. Best chicken and waffles I've had. They treat their guest like kings..Chocolate chip cookie AWESOME.

XZe_AitY_KrcmeiiCkBpLg.text: I wish we had gotten here sooner!  The food was absolutely fantastic.  Seasoning was terrific and the portion sizes were incredible.  Will absolutely be coming back in the future.  Great service as well!

yXMvsmIsuUeaNRyjXljYag.text: OMG--new fave breakfast place!!! Great food, great service. Super nice folks. And, as a jazz lover, I'm loving the music on a Sunday morning. So happy I discovered this place!

pHiBCT-dZNnLFaI1NOG5kQ.text: Not only is the food great here, the hospitality is off the charts. They made great efforts to provide us the best breakfast accommodating for my allergies. The complementary dessert was the best I have had at any breakfast place. I would give them 10 stars if I could.

However, food was high end with great presentation and friendly service. They had the best breakfast potatoes. Highly recommended!

CMMA3WKcwJtEGV4BlJjhbQ.text: Visited for the first time today with the family and it definitely exceeded my expectations!! Everything was perfect, the delicious food, portion size & customer service! There are so many options on the menu to pick from so anyone can find exactly what they're craving! Definitely my new favorite spot in town.

ngdHbdwu3Qo0TYbmR_msnw.text: I'm from LA and I was looking for a great place to eat with my family and came across this small place which the food was excellent and staff is great. If you are looking for an affordable good quality food this is the place.

ZGM2mghkWNepedQGfVKwrQ.text: Understated spot with delicious, unique, but simple and healthy food! Like a homemade meal, good prices and you get freebies! So glad we found this spot while visiting the Vegas area.

HoaKqeVUTBqyuzYYCtMYiA.text: Been here a couple times. This is my first review maybe second ... anywhere ... on anything ... just don't do it. For me to do it now says a lot. Try Zenaida's you won't be sorry. Breakfast or Lunch it's very good.

jtQ_-VX_KhgkT1MGfUWRqw.text: Never been to Vegas & just flew in to receive awards at the NAB Convention.  Our group was starving & Zenaida's reviews looked great. Let me further express how good the food is here!  The portions are large & very yummy!  I had the Cheeseburger with thick cut bacon (yum!) & homemade potato salad.  My GF enjoyed the Cobb salad, and had plenty to take some home with us.  Others in our group enjoyed: Biscuits & Gravy - Wow!  I've never seen them like this before!  The other dish was Eggs Benedict.... it obvious there's a full fledged Chef back in the kitchen!  Try it, you won't be disappointed!

Z8zxjoSIbJAK3gKwnPlebQ.text: The service was amazing. We were greeted with a smile the minute that we walked in. The waiter was friendly and fast. I ordered the spinach, feta with sauteed heirloom tomato's. It was fantastic! My boyfriend ordered the steak omelet. He didn't realize it had pork and asked for the same dish without meat. The chef was wonderful! He asked if chicken would be a good. He even brought out the dish personally! Such great service! I've never felt more welcomed and at home. It's definitely the move the next time I'm in the area.

BfKQGxAyh36EURyukJArVw.text: This place is a hidden gem! My bf lives by here, and one day we passed by this place and read their menu that's posted by the door and we told ourselves we have to try it one day. Well today was that day, we left this with our bellies full of satisfaction and smiles on our faces. Our server was very nice, even stopping to let us know their specials and how they have dinners on Friday nights. The chef and owner, Sterling, came out to greet us and chat about his cooking style and the restaurant. He's a really awesome guy and his food taste amazing. We got the avocado toast, tofu scramble, waffles, breakfast potatoes, and scrambled eggs. Chef Sterling also gave us free Apple cobbler, which my bf and I couldn't stop eating. If you're in the area, or even just wanting to try a new place with great flavors come try out Zenaidas. My bf and I will definetly be back!

Five star food, presentation and service in the place you would least expect to find it! Go for their specials, like avocado toast appetizer and breakfast wrap. Service is unbelievable...even the chief came out a couple of times to ask how we liked things. Really 5 Stars!

V0Num11cqUhjiVKv4fLK3g.text: If you are looking for a place to eat this is the place! It is a family owned restaurant. That Dad is the main cook, Mother looked to be the host, Daughter was a server and the son was the Dad line cook. The food was down right delicious! We are from utah and don't really know good places to eat around here and this was the first 5 star restaurant on yelp we saw so we had to give it a go and it by far surpassed the 5 stars! The service was spot on, food was delicious, they were kind, happy, and very generous. At the very end of our meal they surprised our group with some freshly made cookies, fresh fruit and whip cream. We will be returning! Thank you for the service and the hospitality!

Too bad I live in New Jersey or I would be eating there everyday. The chef even gave us a complimentary plate of cookies and cream which were freaking out of this world! If you are in Vegas and you don't go, you're missing out big time!

y_qtyZn939O5_wIeg73fAw.text: One of my favorite breakfast spots in town. Definitely has a very friendly staff and owner. Very humble, generous, and lastly, they have great talented chefs in their kitchen. Highly recommended.

_FlerdNJJyUGnQL6wm-1tw.text: I don't know why it has taken me so long to write a review for this place. I ABSOLUTELY LOVE IT HERE! The food here is 5 stars with very reasonable prices. I always get the avocado toast to start, which is just wonderful. It comes on crostinis with cherry tomatoes, pickled red onion (which complements the dish really well), balsamic glaze, olive oil, and topped with a salad. I usually get the eggs Benedict which is just perfect. Its not with traditional Canadian bacon. Its even better! It comes with thick cut slab bacon and the hollandaise sauce is perfect! I tried the biscuits and gravy. It was fantastic and very hearty! Chef Sterling and staff are AMAZING! They make you feel so welcome here. I can't say enough how much I love this place! Its a must try. You wont be disappointed!

mAJF4TKLAKDW0KKU2NetUA.text: This was one of the best dinning experiences I have ever had!! I ordered the fried chicken and waffles and the biscuits and gravy. The chef even gave us complimentary cookies at the end! In addition, he came out and asked us how the meal was:)

y2vnxWqPZq6cJDeSJW0IOg.text: Oh my goodness. Let me just say this is probably the best breakfast place I've ever been to. I've always felt like home cooked meals are best because you can taste the love someone puts into their food and I can honestly say it tasted like a home cooked meal. I'm big on breakfast but my mom was in town and she's huge on "yelping" lol. We were not disappointed. I had the waffle with bacon. Do not skip the whip. The bacon was a thick cut slice and that was really good too lol. Everything was exceptional; the clam chowder, the chicken and waffles, chicken and fries EVERYTHING.

0aqaUKrdJMbk1aQz198Dsw.text: Went there based on Yelp reviews and I understand why this place is so higly rated. Lots of variety on the menu even for pescatarians, vegetarians and vegans, very reasonable prices especially given the quality of the food and the copious serving, and everybody is incredibly friendly. Lovely place, I will definitely be back!

vLcO0vsSbvaUZWuBB-V3kA.text: Great breakfast place. I had NY steak and eggs. The hash browns style tasted so good and the steak was ok so The food was awesome and good service. I will be back.

MzcCQWAHJRrY8DNi2YhCsA.text: I regret ever checking in here on Facebook and I absolutely regret adding to the 180 - 5 Star reviews that are 100% justified. Selfishly, I don't want anyone else to know about how amazing this restaurant is because I want to be able to get a table. Amazing everything. The passion for the craft is here.

SZRfYh45omxWkZo_XrRHCA.text: This is my favorite breakfast place,food is amazing and service excellent. I would recommend this place to anyone  The chef is a great cook! Just love it no other place like this.

e7gCL64Ri-XqfqIF9740fw.text: This place is great. Off the beaten path, not busy, simple but very good food. It's a welcome relief from all the try-hard food you find on the strip.

FpbyZjyPgW-7d7P22JY9aA.text: Amazing food and amazing customer service. Chef came up to us to check in. Definitely worth every penny! We will be back.

oVP6joEH-i_IklEwdYIyVA.text: We came on a Saturday for brunch. We enjoyed the most amazing food and wonderful service. The chef came out to greet us and we were not shy to gush over his food. Forget the buffet on the strip this is where you want to come for a meal that's unforgettable.    Our family wanted a nice quiet place with just good food and we found it here. The Eggs Benedict were superb, the biscuits and gravy were amazing, all with nice seasoning and the right amount of spice and good old comfort food. The pancakes were light and fluffy and the size of your head. The chips and aoli and cookies and cream were wonderful delights.   This gem will be on must visit list when coming through vegas.

QYdo-YXk3QnscEce3fgiNw.text: We went here for the first time today. A very nice restaurant with everything bright, shiny and clean with upscale decor and background music. I ordered the cinnamon roll which was fabulous. My wife is an eggplant lover and got the eggplant stack. She loved it. The personnel were professional, efficient and friendly. When the waiter brought the  check he also brought 2 chocolate chip cookies. Nice touch ( and very tasty ). Highly recommend.

tcBMSMq0g6mz_T-J9Gw31Q.text: Customer service was great, chef even came to all the tables to talk about the food quality and apologized for the extra time it took which was very nice of him. Food was exceptional as well, great place to eat !

-UgjuUhW_C-ef3TXl40q3A.text: Heard good things about this place and we were really happy that we tried it out.  The rosemary fries were great.  The servers were excellent and took wonderful care of our table.  The chef came out and said hello to everyone and gave us freshly baked cookies at the end of the meal.    We'll be going back.

qL784F3p-vJ-bSNu3Shqbg.text: Try the fried eggplant lettuce sandwich! I'm in food heaven. We are visiting Vegas again over Christmas and I want to visit this restaurant again!

Gw_TiHq1SAxcuI6Le8lBMA.text: We just got there, everything was awesome, the customer service really good because they are very friendly; the food was delicious, even my picky son enjoyed his food without any word. I absolutely recommend anyone to come here, you'll enjoy this place.

DNWUWIrWuXJtkrZ7DwRF8Q.text: Id been wanting to try this place for a while and it was great. pretty presentation. great service.  can't wait to go back.

AIEtZxdRwrsAcKIcrm351g.text: Outstanding!!! Great service, wonderful atmosphere and unbelievably delicious food. I would honestly like to give them 10 stars.

c-Figh2VBNvEiHRrcdnGDg.text: Avocado toast and a giant, fresh salad on the East side? Zenaida's was an unexpected find, to say the least. The avo toast is a must-order, combining garlic bread and the trendy healthy breakfast dish to excellent results, with a small salad that makes the $8 "appetizer" easily suitable as a meal. The Cobb salad is traditionally prepared, adding some oomph with a cilantro ranch.  Location has a variety of seating options, and plenty of attentive staff. Food came out a bit slowly, so maybe call ahead if you are coming in on a short lunch break. Portions are large and all of the produce was super-fresh, which is hard to find on this side of town for anything but Mexican food. Looking forward to coming back to try their quinoa burger!

gcwKDBUJUJWiY8BWsDUXIg.text: My compliments to the chef! My friend and I tried Zenaida's today for the first time. We will certainly be back! She had an omelette from the specials and I had the braised beef special. Both were amazing! Perfectly crispy and savory. Even the biscuit on the side was decadent. The ambience and decor is really cute. The staff is really personable. You can tell they aim to personalize your experience. They even gave us free food: Housemade potato chips served with a delicious sauce and for dessert chocolate chip cookies which were to die for! We also shared a cinnamon roll which was served with a delicious whipped cream and berries. Excellent food. Excellent service. All around a great dining experience!

iSqcLnVIWjqADE_3QqxC5w.text: Zenaidas IS my favorite breakfast and lunch place in Las Vegas. We had an excellant experience here with the smoked salmon plate, shrimp and avocado benedict's and great coffee. The service was pleasant and competent, and the owner and Chef came out and greeted every table before we left. We received a pleasant surprise with a complementary desert. We came her every morning and enjoyed every dish. The breakfast potatoes were always warm and crispy as well

MbGTMa_JjElQWkDggMABWQ.text: This place is a must in LA.. the staff were friendly and the food was served in just a matter of time(no wait at all). gGxbB7yJqxrPlz3c2vIbpA.text: Wow!  The food and staff were amazing.  The chef came out several times to ask how everything was, and it was perfect.  The chicken & waffles were excellent and the crispy eggplant was the best I've ever had. Will definitely visit again.

CPxi_nTfV0Svp6ceWuYrXQ.text: Love this little quaint cafe. The food was delicious and I loved the fact that the chef touched every table making sure all of his patrons were happy with the food. You don't find personalized service anymore. To top off a great meal were the warm complimentary chocolate chip cookies. My friend who is not eating sugar couldn't resist and she said it was worth the cheat! My only wish is that it was on my side of town.

K0UHUYZ2DuDahfsB_lyH0w.text: Enter to see empty tables, but told there is a wait... okay...  Finally seated, I ask for coffee and water. Person I am with asks for water. We get one water and one coffee.... hmmmm....  Wait and wait and wait for order to be taken... four employees wandering around.... unorganized. Finally order... waiter was dismissive and cold.... opinion plummeting.... Received our order of cinnamon roll and a biscuit and gravy add eggs.... looked pretty. Flavor of gravy... fair... hamburger gravy... biscuits were fair.... the hot links added a bit of seasoning to otherwise flat flavored plate... Finished biscuit and gravy.... go to take a bite of cinnamon roll... cannot cut through with fork.... bad sign.... take knife to it.... still have to pull it apart rather than cut it.... supposedly fresh made... when? Two days ago???!!!! Employee says today... yeah right! Friend is now totally angry.... we've had poor service, watched other get poor service, watched another pair walk out from lack of service.... another pair waiting for an eternity for bill and to go box! That did it! Friend got waiter, complained, waiter looked stunned!  I wonder if they have any idea of the impression they make.... They went from minimally apologetic to non apologetic and we walked out.... done. We won't be back.

Wb2cLSTODZDxRH_F--IwMQ.text: Love this place! My boyfriend and I always come for a special brunch. The owner and chef is so kind, and always comes up to the table to greet us. He also sends complimentary sweets after our meals. Portions are great, we usually get full and end up taking some home. We always recommend others to try this place when they can. Definitely worth a shot, and underrated.

nwtrW_6GafPmpnBc1oLGJQ.text: Great food, great service! Thanks for the treat on my first visit! I will be back to try other entrees.

KnRHhp5UIIGxqA2ojOW-dw.text: After spending at least 20min on yelp trying to find somewhere new for breakfast, I found this gem and trusted the five stars, perfect menu and reviews.   People of Vegas, don't look any further!!  First time here and we will now be regulars.   Perfect food, excellent service, and fairly priced with large portions!!   I ordered biscuits and gravy. Biscuits were fluffy and the sausage links were sooo good. The gravy was perfect. The best I've ever had I can't believed I finished the whole plate!!  Don't be hesitant if you think it's too much for you to eat, it's savory and filling but not too heavy.  We also ordered the fried chicken and waffles. My husband said it tasted like Disneyland, even tho he's never been, I took a bite and right away felt like I just walked through Heaven.  Culinary at its finest. Everything came out perfect. The chef is the owner and he was so nice.  Eat where the employees and owner take pride in their food and business like these guys!

P7AILzhnhuzvzrJ4epmw7Q.text: I tried this place because of it's reviews, and the posted pictures. I was NOT disappointed! I love little hidden away gems! Oh and how can you hate a place that brings you a free warm chocolate chip cookie you didn't even ask for!

g9WhH5R8JKNM2Vb4eobZ4g.text: This quaint cafe is simply amazing! We started our meal with the garlic rosemary fries and they were perfect. Aside from being expertly seasoned, the serving size was very generous as well. To our surprised, we were also served some homemade kettle chips. I've never met a potato I didn't like, and these chips were no exception. As for my meal, I ordered the shrimp and avocado eggs Benedict. It was inarguably one of the best breakfasts I've had in months. I strongly believe that the hollandaise sauce is the best part of a Benedict, and theirs was among the best I've ever had! Right when we thought we physically could not eat anymore, our server brought us out some cookies complements of the chef. Par with the course, they were fantastic. The chef actually came out to greet some customers, which was certainly a nice touch. Overall, I cannot rave about Zenaida's enough!

oj6jvJNox3rzSHNU0qluWw.text: Great food!  I apologize for not having pictures but trust me on this. PLEASE don't miss out on the mac and cheese bites as well as the biscuits and gravy! oh my goodness, incredible. you get your money's worth and more!   aside from the food, service was great & they made sure everyone was pleased with their meals. Added an egg but didn't need it; came with two or 2.5 full biscuits, gravy plentiful but not sloppy at all! Our crew got breakfast burritos that came with totally, chicken & waffles, all very good and more than enough food for hungry, hungover guys.

IXdenslpcWlcJ3HuVOWp7A.text: The food was delicious.  I had the Mac and Cheese with Sausage....5 types of cheese...mmm so good and Fried Garlic and Rosemary potatoes.  DELICIOUS....yes lots of carbs but so worth it.  Love the service and even met the co owner Zenaida what a lively woman.  Please support local restaurateurs in this competitive market.  This is a gem of a place.  Came all the way from Tucson, Az and it was so worth it!

4VJS0mfwiw_TBOEWM0W72A.text: I just had a wonderful time at Zenaida's Cafe!  From the warm greeting, to the complimentary homemade chips & aioli, to the delicious Mother's Day brunch my family and I had, I would highly recommend this place!!!  The chef and staff go out of their way to make this a memorable experience!  From avocado toast, to eggs Benedict, to Asian chicken salad and a pork chop Stack, I am sure everything on the menu is just as delicious as what we had!  My son had the brunch special with lobster bisque, (with Huge chunks of lobster) smoked salmon Benedict and a yummy dessert!  Excellent!  Then to complete the meal, the chef sent out a some warm, gooey, homemade chocolate chip cookies, drizzled in Caramel sauce, also complementary!  Thank you to Zenaida's for making it a fabulous Mother's Day!  We will definitely go back!!!

RYiDiLlxKYhIEtY4FnVKAw.text: I usually don't leave comments, but this place was so good I had to say something. This place is absolutely worth making the trip away from the strip for. Service is top notch and the food is incredible.

4tRk0x8JI1Y00SMuz7KsoQ.text: Amazing! A Vegas hidden gem! Delicious food and excellent chef. Always wonderful meeting the chef  amazing food and even better service. Very accommodating.

VNQZsmD_-V3GtPdX5ZwJeg.text: Let's start with the Avocado Toast. I had read other reviews describing how awesome it is. Until you try it, you just have no idea what you're missing! Crunchy garlic toast with avocado and heirloom tomatoes with a sliver of red onion. WOW, my taste buds have been forever altered. My wife had the chicken and  waffles. Seriously, c'mon, are you guys this good at everything? I didn't try the chicken, but the waffles were amazing! Truly worth it just for the waffles alone. But don't forget the Avocado Toast. I had the Mac and Cheese with gator style sausage. I was disappointed, that there wasn't more! I was stuffed about 2/3 the way through it but I just couldn't stop eating that creamy, slightly spicy, bowl of nirvana! I haven't even told you about the cookies the chef sent out when we were done! Real whipped cream, soft, gooey cookies. Still warm! If I lived in Vegas, I'd be here daily, hands down the best place to go and just minutes from the strip! The guys in the kitchen are Gastric Gods! I will be back, even if I have to walk from Colorado!

lyclTBfHdg9nkqUkc_4PAQ.text: Saw this place in the Weekly. A bit of a drive and hard to find. Be sure you ask for the homemade potato chips. I had eggs Benedict on a bed spinach. Thick cut pork belly that reminded me of France. Way to good to be in a strip mall. The whiskey soaked bred pudding should labeled a controlled substance! Will definitely come back. ***** Ray

OVK4cgL73-xIfwwhwHTLcw.text: Best breakfast place for outstanding food. Anyone coming from outside of Vegas must come and have food here. Atmosphere, staff, and cooks are absolutely amazing.

Special treats: a portion to share of lovely hand-made potato chips, then fresh chocolate chip cookies smothered in chantilly cream and strawberries!   Super sweet. Next time we're here we will be back.  This is an ideal spot to stop on your way back to the airport!

Qb9DxySR6DYoi9jXHKjMJA.text: OMG service is on point! This place is fantastic! I had the eggs Benedict and my boyfriend had the breakfast burger, we didn't take pictures because the food was devoured! The chef even came out to ask how the food was, it tasted great... GREAT! Definitely will be coming back!

yDWlHv7Vamxx4LL9t9rc8w.text: Came here for breakfast based on great Yelp reviews. Well Yelpers, you did not disappoint! I'm glad that we tried this diamond in the rough. I loved the mom and pop feel of the restaurant. The food presentation keeps up with the modern trend and the taste is even more amazing. We ordered the smoked salmon with Bagel, loved the fixings that came with it. Also ordered a breakfast sandwich with Portuguese sausage (Monte Cristo Sandwich) and that was a good choice! It was very filling. Their burgers are huge and tasty. Their waffles with fresh strawberries also did not disappoint, big portion as well. Love love that they serve homemade chips to start with and they end our meals with super gooey chocolate chip cookies with a side of whipped cream, both complimentary! Staff are super friendly, that's always a bonus. Will definitely be back and recommend to friends.

While we were there regulars kept coming in, and I could tell cause the staff knew their names. The chef even sent us cookies and cream on the house. We will be back!

BUdepcTEuUEfznNEXvynUQ.text: I was looking for something quick to grab the other morning. I saw the reviews on here and decided to give this place a whirl. I also ordered the biscuits and gravy which weren't quite what I expected, but they were still delicious. I definitely recommend this place to anyone looking for a breakfast spot. pldB9atn3AtTtty9JywEJw.text: Where to begin? HUGE. Portions of unique tasty food. Chef Sterling was making the rounds in the dining room and advised us of the specials including oxtail hash and fresh salmon he caught in Seward, Alaska. The has was excellent, crispy as requested. My wife ordered Mac & cheese with blackened salmon. The Mac and cheese portion was enough for 3 people, creamy and cheesy, although we would have preferred less truffle oil. Prices were reasonable. The space is Nicky decorated. They turned a shopping center store front into a comfy pleasant space with the use of an assortment of furnishings designed to separate the space into dining, front of house and customer waiting area. Super friendly servers. Oh great floors.

OBKcqib1_mUEbjlJSfVEkA.text: This place was perfect for breakfast. Great atmosphere, food and music -- and the hospitality was more than I bargained for. I love eggs Benedict, so that's just what I ordered. Cooked to perfection with homemade hollandaise sauce, thick cut bacon and the poached eggs were perfect. My daughter ordered the Asian chicken salad which she also enjoyed. Homemade potato chips were served compliments of the chef and to finish off the meal we were also served warm chocolate chip cookies drizzled with a caramel sauce and powdered sugar. Yum! And they play contemporary jazz while you're enjoying your meal.  If you're looking to get away from the crowded strip while on vacation, this is the place to be.

9umMvufBcbXbu0_pCuRbxg.text: We had a chance to wait for a few minutes before a table was ready. It gave my wife and I a chance to enjoy the cool photos they have for sale. They also have jazz playing. Not "let's-play-a-Michael-Jackson-song-and-add-a-saxophone-to-it" smooth jazz, no this is straight ahead jazz. I enjoy that on a lazy Sunday.  We received an order of fresh potato chips and sauce. Compliments of the chef.  My wife had the biscuits and gravy. The hot links were just spicy enough. Interesting that they use a brown gravy instead of the usual.  I ordered the eggs Benedict. After I ordered, the staff informed me that they had run out of the slab bacon, so I had to settle for the regular ham. It was okay. The hollandaise had a bit more lemon than I usually like but it was not off-putting. I was a little upset. If I have my taste buds ready for something, I do not appreciate substitutions well. I'm whiney? Sure! Do I pay for my food? Yes! So, I guess I can act like a disappointed middle schooler if I want. Usually, after careful thought and reflection, I can appreciate what I had, but in this case, I really was intrigued by this "slab bacon" and was quite disappointed by getting something less. I get it. It's popular. I can understand limit of product. I thought we were there early enough. Maybe because it was the day after the time change...who knows. It certainly did not take away from the quality of the meal nor the staff. Both were impeccable.  After our meal, the chef sent out moist chocolate chip cookies with yummy cream sauce. Very good.  So, the verdict was, we liked it well enough to try it again and I would definitely recommend giving this place a try. I'm sure you will dig it.

I wanted my eggs super runny and he made it perfectly how i wanted it.  My hunnies eggs Benedict was perfected poached! I highly recommend the avocado toast! My goodness that was a great starter!!

EWtbM9hu_YYoupUPCTqUwQ.text: What a hidden gem! Stumbled on this place and, like others say, the service was whiskey absolutely amazing! The food was also delicious, and I would come back in a heartbeat. Definitely check this it out!

ysV9C_DJ1A0WfVO9zyIXDw.text: Thoroughlyenjoyedthis  My boyfriend and I are SO happy we came across Zenaida's Cafe. Great place to come for breakfast/lunch, really cute and clean setup, and mellow jazz playing in the background ... Not only will we be coming back -- we intend on making this our honorary "spot." Yay   We ordered:  Garlic parmesan fries: which, c'mon. Garlic freakin' fries. Bomb, am-i-rite?!  Eggs Benedict: this is the one item I have to try anywhere I go and base a good majority of my judgement on. And YASSS. My eggs were poached perfectly (which may I say is not thaaat easy to do, speaking from my own experience, anyway) the hollandaise was light and bright and nicely cut through the mmm mmm major savoryness from the SLAB bacon. SO impressed.  But the avocado toaaaasssttt you guys: bro. I'm not a big avocado person (weird, I know.) And I'm not a big avocado toast person. Yeea. Not my first choice. But BROO.  Why doesn't ALL avocado toast taste like this? Avocado mash is served on top of garlic crostinis with the most perfect texture and thickness and garlickyness, duh, (bread is life) with tomatoes and balsamic glaze and a little arugula salad on the side. I chose to have this as my last good bite to seal the deal to an epic meal. #noregrets  We also got to try a little side of sweet potato chips which was so thin and fun to eat -- they're what's usually served with items on their vegan menu. And judging by the awesomeness of flavors we had, I'm actually anxious to try said vegan menu   Chef Sterling also sent out a couple warm, melt-in-your-mouth (and kind of in your hands too) gooey chocolate chip cookies that were SO good. Emphasis on SO. And emphasis on good, while we're at it.   Chef Sterling actually made the time to come and check up on us and every table for that matter and we got to chat for a little bit. Now, my boyfriend and I have worked for restaurants for a long time so we know what qualities to look for and, wow, SO MUCH respect for Chef Sterling -- what he's doing with his food, the background he comes from, how he interacts with his guests -- all very respectable and impressive and it's just great form of a real chef.   Jaime was great too handling the whole place, relaying orders straight to chef, never missing a beat.   So. Just to recap. Throughly enjoyed. Will be back. Wonderful flavors. Lots of options. Great staff. AWESOME chef. Super impressed. Just do it, guys. Trust.

Photo of Zenaida's Cafe - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benni with better-than-your-normal breakfast potatoes. Wayy better.

BsgZWUsAb1UduS0FM275wg.text: Vegas is home to many great places to eat, both large and small -- and there's a great many of these off the Strip, in places where only the locals would think to look. Hidden gems like this are hard to find, even more so when everything around you is a gem! Which is all the why I value this place: Zenaida's Cafe.   A cozy little restaurant in the middle of town, Zenaida's is run by another culinary heavyweight in town: Sterling Burpee, the former executive chef for the Wynn Resorts. Taking his experience on the Strip and opening up an eatery named for his wife's and daughter's middle name, Zenaida's is truly one of those hidden gems of Vegas!  While it's known for its breakfast and brunch fare, Zenaida's ALSO hosts a spectacular jazz dinner once a month on Fridays, where you really get to eat like a high-roller on the Strip! This review is thus special in that it will focus on both the regular visit from the weekend before last, and the jazz dinner from this past Friday.  During the brunch hours, they offer all sorts of breakfast and brunch fare from eggs and sandwiches to vegan and vegetarian options. There's something there for everyone, no matter what you can or can't eat! For brunch, my father and I ordered the same thing: their corned beef hash, a generous and flavorful bowl of beef and potatoes topped with eggs of your choice and scallion hollandaise, and served with toast. It was a flavorful plate of food -- and we also got potato chips at the start of the meal and complementary dessert in an apple berry cobbler! Everything was delicious -- and at such an affordable price, this place really has it all.  The jazz dinner is also just as amazing -- my mother, being the jazz aficionado of our family, was my guest for that dinner. Here, you get a prix fixe three-course menu with sumptuous options like filet mignon, veal, and seafood! My mother ordered a Caesar salad, linguini with clams in white wine sauce, and tiramisu, while I got lobster bisque, filet mignon with truffle butter, and a bananas foster creme brulee.  The food I ordered was excellent -- the bisque was touched off with brandy, which I could taste in the soup itself along with the fresh lobster. The filet mignon was perfectly tender and cooked medium rare, the way I liked it, though I do think the butter could have melted more prior to service. Everything about the main course was delicious. The dessert was the biggest surprise, though -- the bananas foster creme brulee wasn't overly sweet, but you could still taste every component of the dessert in it. It was my personal favorite item on the entire prix fixe meal. My mother also enjoyed her dinner immensely, though her only complaint was that the clams in her linguini weren't served in their shells. All the while, we were serenaded by a local jazz group, the Eric Vaughn Trio, who were enchanting to listen to!  During the entire experience, Sterling would come out to check on us, talking to me about how things have been since we last saw each other, and wishing us well when we left -- and that, I think is the magic of Zenaida's. Good food, good people, the charming ambience of the restaurant interior -- it doesn't feel like you're eating at a restaurant. It feels more like you're visiting a friend you haven't seen in a while, sharing a meal and catching up on what's new. That charm is something many restaurants in town lack, and the main reason why I'm such a loyal regular even though I hadn't gone there in months prior to these visits. Zenaida's prides itself on "just good food", and they deliver -- so why not check it out for yourself? Don't let the location scare you, this place is DEFINITELY worth the trip!

RoiMrjo_xMb-zOIILHhRrw.text: I will start by saying that one main of the reasons I find to visit beautiful Las Vegas several times a year is to dine at Zenaida's. I had one bite of the Vegan Scramble (a jasmine fried rice dish w/ tofu) and was instantly smitten. - In fact there are so many VEGAN options not to mention vegetarian choices that today when deciding to finally try something other than the vegan scramble for once I didn't know what to choose! I opted for the off regular menu special of the Vegan Cabbage Rolls. - I still got an order of the vegan fried rice to take on the plane tho! The cabbage rolls had jasmine rice, quinoa, ground veggie meat, and a delightful spiced sauce of tomatoes accented with fermented black beans of all things. It made for a meritage of flavors I quite enjoyed. After the complimentary house chips and aioli, paired with an appetizer of Mac and cheese balls, fried of course, not to mention some of my dining companions gigantic (and heavenly warm, gooey and delicious) cinnamon roll joining the party, I was unable to finish the rolls as the portion is quite large. A great plate to share if you are getting a few things to split. You also get complimentary warm cookies at the end of your meal.  Service is always warm and on point, and chef always takes the time to stop by every table, no one excluded to thank them for coming in and ensuring they enjoyed the meal; when he is not behind the line himself or overseeing operations. Don't forget they are closed Monday and Tuesday. It is also a small cozy restaurant so expect a wait during peak times, it's typically fairly quick for 2 tops, the larger the party the longer the wait.

PSho6BJJIB53eLpTr-dIGw.text: In a city that is saturated with endless miles of strip malls all containing at least one restaurant of some sort or another, I believe we have found the best one of the bunch!  Zenaida's Cafe is a complete jewel! The interior is CLEAN (rare in Vegas these days) and beautifully decorated. The staff was wonderful and provided the most friendly customer service (also rare in Vegas these days) of anywhere we had experienced during our trip. Now, the star of the show - The Food!  Everything was amazing, but I need to focus on two particular items that will leave me with life-long memories.    First, the bacon! Now I know you're thinking, "Bacon Love is so 2014," but I'm telling you that this was the best bacon I've ever had! It is thick cut and cured to perfection! It was really meat candy!  Finally, the Avocado Toast! Lord, this was everything every other Yelper said it was and MORE! Beautiful, delicious and perfectly prepared and presented!  The perfectly thin garlic rubbed toast, topped with quality ingredients; avocado, heirloom tomato, pickled onion and a balsamic drizzle - WOW, just wow!   The owner came out and was super cool! So, if you're looking for an off-strip, fantastic breakfast, this is the place! Thank me l

Zd-HSeRlER-aHTKPEjp8wQ.text: A group of my nursing classmates and I, tried Zenaida's today for brunch. When we walked in around 12, we were told there was a 20 minute wait, although we saw many tables open? After observing a few minutes it looked like they only had 1 server. Being that this place has 5 stars, I didn't let the wait bother me - plus the 20 minutes went by quickly especially if you have group of friends to converse with- plus the wait gave us time to review the menu in detail ;)   Today I tried the Quinoa Burger. This dish really surprised me, with its rich flavor from the pita bread, sauce, melted cheese and fresh slices of avocado - I was really shocked with the flavor it consisted of. It's exactly what you would imagine a quinoa burger to be. So the quinoa was compressed to give an illusion of a burger patty, unfortunately it did not stay together for long and it ended up becoming a yummy mess. My friend ordered the eggplant stack! This I would totally order again. Basically it's a breaded egg plant on a lettuce, and tomato "protein style burger" (no bun). It basically tasted like a onion ring but with more flavor.  Please note: after your meal your server will be bringing out fresh baked cookies, compliments of the chef. These will probably be the best cookies you've ever tried.   This place definitely serves up some unique dishes and I would recommend it for others to try.

HcTfuMH8xUq7AFd8LwRJ5Q.text: Cute cafe with delicious fare done up right!   This brightly decorated spot served up some fantastic sandwiches and other fare that is sure to suit everyone's palette. From healthy quinoa burgers to a fantastic Z Monte Cristo that was to die for, I'm sure there is nothing on the menu that could disappoint. And, as others have mentioned, their bacon is incredible. Thick cut, extra crispy and not soggy and sad like I've had at other spots. I love that depending on your taste, you can have your share of comfort food or something lighter. I will have to come back for the Crispy Eggplant Stack which sounded amazing. I can totally appreciate the creativity and effort they put in their dishes.  Service is phenomenal. That above all is the reason why I would return on my next trip. Very warm, genuinely kind people that work that there who truly love what they do and take pride in the food they prepare. A rarity nowadays.   Thank you Zenaida's Cafe! We are sure to return. 5 stars.

ZEgDjjBrOozDcTHrz_IDuA.text: Delicious food. We tried the Monte Cristo which is a non-sweetened type, and the Eggs Benedict. The thick cut bacon made the food taste even better. At first we thought maybe they weren't going to charge us for it since it was so small, but alas we were wrong. The fresh baked cookies at the end were definitely a plus. Great coffee too.

eZB9gboqmO7P3NXbsJBU9w.text: If you blink you'll miss this delicious place.  I have wanted to try this place for a while now, and I am glad I finally did. There is plenty of parking, and the interior was welcoming and had a good amount of space.  I had the eggs benedict, and it was very tasty. The bacon to the potatoes. There was strawberries too that were super fresh. The chef sent over a plate of fresh cookies. Yum yum yum. I mean I could have started the meal with the cookies.  I enjoyed the service, and even the chef stopped by to see how the meal went. A solid place to have breakfast.

lLISjsgXIEnqf0rhIgysUw.text: My initial impression when we walked in was mixed.  I was looking forward to trying somewhere new, we were greeted immediately when we walked in and sat right down.  My pet peeve is when a breakfast place doesn't serve decaf coffee, they do serve decaf, "instant".  No thanks. How about iced tea?  Is it fresh brewed?  No. Well dang.  Water it is. One star is taken off my review for that.   We ordered the homemade cinnamon roll, it's beautiful but when you get past the delicious whipped cream and berries the cinnamon roll was kinda dry. Bummer.  I ordered avocado toast with a side of poached eggs.  It's not your average breakfast avocado toast, it's little toastlets (yeah I made that word up) so the egg wasn't a good match but it was tasty with the arugula salad.  My hubby had chicken and waffles, he liked it, I thought it was very sweet, even without syrup.  Service was good, as we were finishing up he brought us cookies compliments of the chef but we were full so we couldn't even taste them. The chef also came out and thanked us, and every table in there, for coming in.  One star gained for that. The personal touches raised my rating from 3 to 4 stars.  Definitely worth a try.

Xm71QcWGmpoN0fOAh88oGg.text: Had breakfast here this morning and was completely overwhelmed by the unexpected deliciousness coming out of their kitchen. Tiny spot in a off-the-main drag location but O! the food was spot on! We ordered Biscuits and Gravy - the biscuits were light and fluffy, the gravy was savory and not too heavy, and the spicy sausage links added a great kick. The pork medallions over hash browns were covered in green onions and a delicious bearnaise. The waffle was crisp and golden. The Salmon and bagel platter was HEAPED with salmon. I loved it all so much I placed an additional three orders to take home to the family that was sleeping in! Bonus -- just when you've reached food coma and your attentive waiter has refilled your coffee for what you think might be the last time... you get cookies and cream as a sweet finisher to your meal. Absolutely drive down to Trop and Pecos and get in on this delicious breakfast / lunch spot. Wear your stretchy pants!!

gMYFpgqJndmJ5f_a_8ji0Q.text: This little neighborhood restaurant is a treasure.  Found it on Yelp and it lived up to its five star billing. Took my wife and five sons here last Saturday morning before hitting the casinos. My oldest sons both had breakfast burritos that were huge and delicious.  Two other sons had fried chicken and waffles.  I tried their waffles and they were delicious. Another son and I had eggs and thick sliced bacon and wheat toast and everything was great, especially the bacon, which seemed freshly cut from a slab of pork belly. My wife got a mammoth sweet roll. The service was excellent. The chef did come out to talk to us and we also got the complimentary strawberry shortcake.  This will be our go-to breakfast place from now on.

ZSOBrfXXARRnfTnm6Ij1qQ.text: This is a must stop for good food homey environment and excellent specialized service. Located 4 miles from the Strip about 10 minutes if you make all the lights-- well worth the drive.  During the Alpha Kappa Alpha 2017 Leadership conference discovered this gemstone of gastric pleasure and satisfaction. You must try the avocado toast with arugula and balsamic vinaigrette.  If you are a shrimp and cheesy grits connoisseur you'll rate Chef Burpy's among the best.  The chicken and waffles are off the chain. There is nothing on the menu that will cause you dissatisfaction. When you've finished your meal and the ambrosia arrives you get an unexpected visit from Chef Burpy thanking you for coming.   This is your opportunity to thank him for a culinary experience equal to a meal at the Bellagio, Top of the World or equivalent. So good that I made the trip to Zenaida's cafe twice during my 4 day Las Vegas stay.  Well done and I'll be back!

MEcybsU7zCWow5iXoREVpA.text: It's rare in life to meet a truly special individual, someone who is so talented that you just feel privileged to be in their presence. This is Chef Sterling, one of the most talented, humble, kind & welcoming people I have ever had the privilege to meet.   It was one week ago today that I was looking for a new breakfast spot to try. Having lived in Las Vegas for 20 years has afforded me the luxury of eating at pretty much every breakfast place in our lovely city. Many have come and gone and many remain eternal, however I can safely say that none have ever been as amazing as Zenaida's.   Living in close proximity to the M Casino currently makes going into town or the strip a pain and typically to get a truly epic breakfast/brunch you have to be willing to travel. But being a foodie I have done it, several times in fact. My willingness to travel is what allowed me the honor of finding Zenaida's as my wife was craving shrimp and grits.  I saw that Zenaida's was being heralded as having good ones, so I looked at the menu online. Immediately I felt something was off. The menu had many items and the description of those items were similar to some of the best restaurants in all of LV. I was extremely intrigued and did a little more research and found one of a picture of a previous "Friday Nights Menu" online. I almost burst into tears upon reading it. It had things I hadn't seen since my grandma made me dinners 30 years ago! I knew instantly that this was going to be special.   I was so worried that we would have to wait over an hour to get in here that I called ahead and asked how long the wait was. The lady that answered let me know there was no wait. I was shocked and we immediately headed down that way (a bit of a drive from the M). Upon arrival we entered and were greeted promptly and were seated. I was looking at the menu and tormenting over what to try when Chef Sterling came out and asked if I had any questions.  He was so accommodating and patient with me. Ultimately I went with the corned beef hash with slab bacon and my wife went with the shrimp and grits. The complimentary potato chips arrived first. Lovely. Very thin and light and I knew they were made in house as was the aioli.  Then the magic happened... The hash... OMG the hash... It was prepared flawlessly. Every detail was perfect. The presentation, the texture, the amount, everything was unreal. The slab cut bacon was also epic. Slab bacon is hard to find in LV and rare to have it cut the right way and even rarer to be prepared correctly, this order was both. My wife being from the South knows grits, she said right away that these were so good that when her mother comes and visits next she is bringing her here as they were among the best she has ever had. We also received a complimentary dessert of cookies and cream. AMAZING!  This meal was so good and left such an impression on me that I went back today (got home about an hour ago) this time I brought a family friend as he had to listen to me rave about it all week! We both ordered the hash (my second time) with the slab bacon. Half way through the meal he looks me dead in the face and says "Carlos, this may be the best breakfast I have ever had in my whole life". I just nodded my head in agreement and kept on eating.   Upon finishing the hash, just when I thought it couldn't get any better... it happened... the impossible... yes the impossible... The Cobbler. It came in two small serving cups, so unassuming, so innocent. I picked up my fork, my friend followed suit. We both took a bite at the same time, we began chewing. It started slowly at first, this feeling... of joy... I was soon overcome by... what was this feeling??? Bliss, pure bliss.   It was not only the best cobbler I have ever had, not only the best dessert I have ever had, it is in the conversation of one of the best things I have ever eaten in my life PERIOD. The waiter came over and I asked him if there was any way to get a full order of it! He asked "you want some to go?" I said "NO!! WE WANT TO EAT IT RIGHT HERE!!" A few moments later we had a full plate of the what can only be described as a little piece of heaven. Of course we ate the whole thing.   This is the best kept secret in all of LV, the ultimate hidden gem. Selfishly a part of me wants to not tell anyone about this unbelievable place. However, eating the food that Chef Sterling prepares is something that everyone should experience as he simply makes the world a better place with his unmatched skills. In going here you will have some of the best food you have ever tasted and it will have been prepared by a person who truly cares about not only his food but about his customers. Chef Sterling cooks every dish with love and you taste it in every bite you take. Those of you who know the difference between good food and True greatness will appreciate this place even more. GO HERE!!!!!  Thank you Chef Sterling for all you do!!!!

2VM0M7oDwpm7AtaAZmGuJg.text: Love this place! Food and service a step above. I do have one slight criticism. Portions are way too large!!! I had a breakfast burrito this morning that I was told was made with 6 eggs. Couldn't finish half of it. Not a great meal for reheating. Smaller portions maybe a little smaller price. I do love this place and want it to succeed. Support local small businesses friends.

tngkDekciofTtRpzFu3-kQ.text: Why is it that whenever I decide to go eat by myself, service is nonexistent? I think I should be getting proper service even if I'm by myself, or did I miss a memo? No one came to check up on me, asked me for a refill, nothing!! The chef came out to greet the other tables and talk about the restaurant. With me? No, he just passed right by me, glanced at me and kept walking. Server dropped of check, I didn't even bother to ask for refill or anything because I just wanted to leave at that point. I didn't know where to pay so I just left it on the table. Food was good, it's just a shame that I can't go out to eat by myself without getting bad service.

5rlsNlnvLeXqLBNWcsb_Ow.text: My husband and I live in the area and are always on the lookout for delicious and independent eateries, and Zenaida's is now our new obsession. I read the reviews and we decided to stop in for lunch, and found the place to be delightfully busy for a Thursday afternoon, so that was a good sign.  A lot of the reviews that I read mentioned the cinnamon rolls, so we ordered one to split and were super excited when this giant, warm and sugary confection topped with a softball sized scoop of fresh whipped cream showed up at our table. It was amazingly delicious, we were sad when we finished and the waiter took the plate! We will absolutely be ordering that again :)  For our main meal, my husband ordered the chicken and waffle and I ordered the cheesy shrimp and grits with my eggs over medium. My husband declared his chicken and waffle to be one of the best he has had in a long time, if not ever, and he expressed wishing he just had a plate of the chicken and some syrup to keep eating. My shrimp and grits were served in a giant pool of some sort of sauce/ gravy, which I was skeptical about at first but quickly fell in love with. In the great fork vs spoon debate for grits, I lean towards the fork side, and the sauce made these a little thinner than I normally like, but I'd eat these as a soup if it came down to it. The egg was a nice touch and further added to the richness of the dish. If I had to find anything wrong with my dish, I'd say the shrimp were just slightly over cooked. Otherwise, this was one of the best meals I have ever had.  Our meal concluded with a greeting from the chef, who was very nice and apologetic for the wait on our food (there really wasn't one, very normal wait), and cookies sent out from the kitchen to each table. We were stuffed, but you don't say no to free homemade cookies, which were warm and gooey and amazing.  We plan on going back very soon and are excited to try many of the other dishes on the menu. I highly recommend this establishment and hope it sees much success for years to come

bGVtHmzSnVtJPd4X71DJXw.text: Chloe wanted pancakes and we were across town, a side we rarely travel to. We searched "pancakes" near our "current location" and Zenaida's Cafe popped up. 5 stars and about 150 reviews?!  Hmmmmmm...our curiosity was sparked!   We pulled up. It looked like a little "homemade" Italian restaurant from out front.   We walked in, and I was utterly confused.  The decor definitely throws you off.  There's this colorful tile that really doesn't do much for the space, and an awkward lounge spot right near the front door with fake fruit in a bowl and everything. Hmmmmm....  The tables are not very inviting...the overall look of the restaurant is not really enticing. If it didn't have 5-Stars, we would have walked out before we even sat down.  There must be something about the food or Yelp has really done us wrong!   We were seated in a 2-top off to the side of the room.  The waiter came by to take our drink orders.  I requested a decaf coffee and he quickly responded "it's instant!" I scrunched up my nose and politely declined.  "We will just take a water then..." This place is not off to a good start.  I didn't know restaurants would ever serve instant coffee in this day & age haha!   We couldn't quite decide what to get. For me, the menu is really limited.  A lot of bacon / pork / beef options but I don't eat any of those things.  I settled for the basic breakfast with 2 eggs, turkey sausage, breakfast potatoes and English muffin (even though I can't eat gluten). They don't have gluten-free options.  Chloe ordered the waffle.   As we waited for our meal, the waitress brought over a pail of homemade chips with garlic aioli. THEY WERE SO GOOD.  Thin, not overly crispy, and seasoned to perfection.  The aioli was good, but it wasn't needed. The chips were amazing as a stand-alone.   Our food was served quickly.  My eggs were perfect.  I was actually really impressed with how perfectly "over medium" they were.  Turkey sausage was just OK.  You can't really rate an English muffin. They are always good haha!   Chloe's waffle, on the other hand, was INCREDIBLE.  The waffle itself was fluffy, thick and served to the perfect texture. It was covered with homemade whipped cream that I think was sprinkled with cinnamon.  There were fresh cut strawberries covering the top of the waffle.  It was soooooooo good.  She didn't use any of the syrup provided. The whipped cream was just the perfect sweetness to compliment the waffle. On the side, Chloe opted for the thick-cut bacon. She said it was amazing.   After our meal, they brought out some homemade cookies complements of the chef. The cookies were topped with their homemade whipped cream. The cookies were warm and delicious.  We took 2 to go, shared one at the table.  Wow.   The service was decent. The chef came out to touch tables before we were served, but had he come out after we ate, I would have thanked him for such a perfect meal.  With all of the chain restaurants and stuck-up chefs on the strip that just leave their name on the marquee while rarely making an appearance, I appreciated the fact that this chef came out to greet his guests and ask how everything is tasting.   I'm not sure if/when we can go back because it's clear across town, but this place deserves the 5 star rating it has.  Don't be thrown off by the decor.  It's really not an issue if the food is THAT delicious!

k_6liCiUQtq6TEWckAXICA.text: My husband was looking for a nice place for breakfast on a Sunday morning, and was wanting something different. He found it!  We were greeted as soon as we walked through the door. After looking at a few photos on yelp, we thought that there was a regular menu of items to choose from. We like to split a meal, and maybe get a side of something as well. We soon realized that we were given a Brunch Menu. (update 1/11/17 ***I have been informed by another Yelper that they are no longer serving Brunch) This is not what we had been anticipating, but the price was so amazing at $13.95/ person. And on the menu was Eggs Benedict, so I was sold.   There were 3 courses for the brunch. I chose the Yogurt Parfait, Eggs Benedict and an Apple Cobbler. My husband chose a traditional Fresh Smoked Salmon Platter, Eggs Benedict and Cheesecake (this one was to go).  We each got a coffee and water. Our waitress brought a plate of large cut lemons for our waters, and brought us fresh brewed coffees. They do not bring around a pot to refill the coffees, but rather bring a fresh mug. The coffee was strong, but good.   My yogurt parfait had blueberries and raspberries along with a half of a strawberry as garnish. The yogurt, granola and fruit were all wonderful. I could have eaten another, but this one was huge! It was just so good. The smoked salmon platter had red onion, capers, egg, tomatoes, Dijon and salmon of course. It came with soda crackers, or what reminded me of them. We were also given freshly made potato chips that were seasoned wonderfully. They were thin and crisp, and were paired with a tasty aioli.   Chef Sterling came out to our table and talked with us a bit. He asked if we were enjoying our meal so far. It was great to learn that he had been the executive chef at the Wynn, and that he had recently opened this awesome restaurant. He asked if he could go ahead and start our Eggs Benedict, and then proceeded to prepare them. After they were brought to our table, he came out to let us know that he uses hand carved, slab cut bacon in his benedict. OH MY GOSH!!! I ALWAYS get bacon instead of Canadian bacon, but hand carved...slab...cut..Wow. I didn't even know this existed. I took a photo of our bacon from the side. You need to look at it, it is so thick. Yum! He makes his hollandaise sauce for each order as well. It was light and flavorful. His potatoes were tender and very slightly crispy as if they were flash fried. The seasoning was perfect. We could not eat all of our breakfast, so we asked for to-go boxes. But then we had an apple cobbler because, why not?!   AMAZING. It truly was. The apples were sweet and wonderful, nice and hot with a side of vanilla ice cream. I did not ask if the ice cream was homemade, but it sure tasted like it could have been. I would not doubt it. It was creamy, and perfect with the hot cobbler.   Chef Sterling's attention to detail is impeccable. This was the best dining experience that we have had in a very long time, and it was just supposed to be a simple breakfast. What a treat. We are definitely coming back to try out more of Chef's goodies. You must come here. You will not be disappointed. He does not advertise, and mentioned Yelp! He asked if we had heard of it (umm...maybe! :D ) So come on Yelpers, check this place out! We wish Chef Sterling all of the best.

butBcdCDK9mvVCirvEOQ5g.text: This is a follow up review to my earlier post, and all I can say is they just keep getting better and better. I'm on their mailing list and each week they send out that week's "Additions" which are basically the specials for the week (Wednesday through Sunday).  My taste buds and I are always amazed at the new offerings each week, and more often than not that's what I get.    This week's additions included a pork loin stack that was incredible. It had blackened pork loin medallions on top of a potato and onion hash and topped with eggs over easy and a tomato-spiked Hollandaise sauce. They finished the meal with a complimentary warm cookie topped fresh whipped cream.   This is an excellent spot to meet your friends and family for weekend brunch. If you get there before the rest of your party you can enjoy a cup of coffee in their lounge area while checking out the small photo gallery. They serve a Primo Columbian coffee and the servers always keep your cup full.   They are very adept at handling large groups as well. I arrived one morning just after a party of 14 had been seated, and despite my fears that I was in for a long wait for my meal, I was served just as promptly as always. If you have a large group they will take reservations.   If you have a sweet tooth be sure to try the cinnamon rolls. Be warned, however, they are huge so you'll probably want to share. The breakfast burger and the eggs Benedict are also excellent choices. The chef makes each order of Hollandaise sauce when you order your meal, so if there is something on the additions menu that includes Hollandaise sauce, go for it!
